Compré este artículo y todo bien, la estética excelente, funcionamiento igual. Al mes de uso empezó a presentar toques fantasma, prácticamente la pantalla se volvía loca. Decidí espérame a devolverlo por qué pensé que era algún fallo de software por la actualización del IOS pero no fue así, al segundo mes prácticamente no me dejaba hacer nada y se volvió frustante, asi que decidí hacer la devolución del equipo tomando en cuenta la garantía de 90 días; hasta el día de hoy llevo 13 días despues de la devolución y estoy en espera del reembolso.

Antes de irse por el precio chequen el proveedor, ya habia comprado antes un iphone 8 y llego lit nuevecito por eso me aventé sin miedo a comprar con INNOVA LOHER, NO SE LES OCURRA, busquen otro, chequen las estrellas del proveedor, me toco un celular que rebosaba de mugre y con el 79% de Batería, cuando aquí en amazon te garantizan que tendrá mínimo el 80%. Estoy súper molesta porque solo me hicieron perder tiempo y horas de trabajo.

column1: OjO!! Me llego con la pantalla llena de rayones, eso sí, con una mica bien colocada, para despistar!
column2: Comprendo que es un producto renewed, pero la pantalla me llegó completamente rayada, y venia con una mica, como para que no se diera uno cuenta… otro rayón a un costado y es entendible sé que es renewed pero de verdad la pantalla está en calidad deplorable, quizás fue mala suerte o no lo sé. Pero en mi caso no fue nada grata la experiencia… ya ti sabrás si te arriesgas o no. Por mi parte yo solicité la devolución.

Estéticamente venía muy bien, solo uno o dos pequeos rayones en la pantalla muy mínimos, la carcasa en perfecto estado.
Al configurar y transferir los datos de mi viejo iPhone me percaté que se calento y al terminar dicha configuración revise la condición de la batería y el iPhone no la reconocía, mencionaba que podía ser una pieza no original.Si no hubiera tenido ese detalle habría estado Perfecto, pero tuve que devolverlo. Así es la suerte

First of all, the iPhone XS itself is still an excellent phone to buy in 2022 , it’s still ableTold its own in 2020. It also arrived earlier than expected, approximately a week early. The battery isn’t as good as advertised and the phone does get quite hot sometimes. But other than that works very well. :)

El teléfono es completamente reacondicionado y en este caso el dueo anterior lo dejo con una estética muy buena (9/10), la batería llego con el 85% de vida útil y la única pega que tendría es que la parte del notch vino demasiado rayada y el parlante frontal si lo pones con mucho volumen se llega a escuchar distorsionado. Por lo que veo en los comentarios es cosa de suerte así que básicamente si lo compras estás a la espera que te toque o un equipo relativamente nuevo o uno malo.

column1: Parece que si es de suerte.
column2: La pantalla y el reverso están en general muy bien cuidados, sin rayones pero con un golpe en la parte de abajo, la batería llegó al 81% (esperaba más) y l bocina del altavoz se escucha un poco raro, cómo reparada. Supongo que es de suerte, yo le daría una calificación de 7 de 10
There were some scratches on the screen protector and the battery was at the lower limits of 'acceptable' (84%). What doesn't help is that the phone was already designed with an anemic battery.

el celular me llego en tiempo y forma, el celular biene bien con una pila con un 83 de vida util, solo que viene con un detalle en la pantalla creo q viene desde el display, se marcan dos circulos en la pantalla casi no se nota solo si lo ves muy detalladamente o en ciertos colores, pero para mi no me afecta y para su precio fue una excelente compra quedo satisfecho. ojo no viene con su caja ni accesorios originales pero el cargador que viene carga muy bien el celular muy rapido.

Buen producto, venía bien cuidado venía sin rallones ni golpes, el gran problema de estos iPhones Reacondicionados es la batería, no es diferente es original, pero la condición viene apenas encima del 80%, me gusto mucho que de todo lo demás esta muy bien y cuidado.

June 2022 update:The phone has stopped working entirely, it seems to be a hardware issue regarding the logic board. There were no noticeable issues leading up to its failure, and I wouldn’t say it’s gone through anything other than a short fall. I can’t remember the battery capacity, but I don’t think it needed servicing just yet. I’m disappointed that it didn’t even last for two years, though I can’t say this is reflective of all Renewed products. I would be hesitant to purchase again.August 2021 update:The battery percent is still 86%, there seems to be no burn-in. The OLED is highly enjoyable especially with black dark modes. The more recent OLED iPhones are much more expensive and the upgrade to an 11 is minor, so a pretty good deal!February 2021:The Renewed description is quite accurate, although and understandably, small scratches are still noticeable at arms length. Unfortunately, there is a small scratch on the camera lens with two very small cracks, though there are no problems with the camera. My iPhone XS has 86% battery capacity which is fine. Aside from the scratch, it looks and runs fine, I assume it’s the luck of the draw regarding any minor defects.Please pardon the screen protector and case in the photos, but there was really only one other small scratch aside from the one on the lens.

column1: Buen precio, mala calidad en la batería.
column2: Me fue funcional solo 4 meses la batería se deterioró por culpa del cable y cargador genérico. Pese a que compre un cargador y cable original, la batería debe ser reemplazada.

Tengo un día con este celular y la verdad es que estoy contento con el. El celular es casi nuevo no tiene ni un golpe. Lo único malo fue que llego algo sucio y que viene con 79%de batería, pero la verdad es que la experiencia es muy buena, lo recomiendo mucho.

En la cámara frontal venía rayado un poco y afecta al tomar fotos y algunos rayones, creo que esta bien por el precio sin embargo no me convenció por esto y la vida de la batería para ser producto renewed. Tal vez no me toco mucha suerte por eso es que pedí reembolso.

Order came in on time.However, once arrived, I noticed that Apple iPhone Xs has a speaker and microphone issue. Sound was really muffled and the other end of the call can barely hear me.Camera is so so quality, even though it has a 12 MP, f/1.8, 26(wide)and dual pixel PDAF,OIS, telephoto camera. It is certainly up to 2021 level.Battery is only Li-Ion 2658 mAh. Would not last a full day of use.

column1: Es bueno pero se descargan rápido
column2: Todo está en excelente estado y sin detallesAunque la batería era de 82 de vida, se agitaba en 4 o 5 horas. Eso no dura la pila de un iPhoneAsí que decidí mejor pedir mi reembolso y conseguir uno mejor en otro lado.

Bastante decepcionado...1. La CAPACIDAD MAXIMA DE PILA llego con 76% lo cuál es bajísimo. No se si regresarlo y comprarlo de nuevo, o mandar a reparar la pila (cuesta en apple sotore $1700)pero me arriesgo a que puedan salir más fallas al celular y ya le invertiría ese dinero, en caso de querer hacer devolución.2. LOS 90 DIAS DE PRUEBA ES FALSO, no se porque Amazon permite esa mentira, son 1 mes máximo (me llegó ayer 1/11/21 y tengo hasta el 4/12/21 para devolución3. Es el segundo Iphone que compró aquí, el primero iPhone X lo regrese por problemas en FACE ID y la capacidad máxima de pila bajo de 91 a 86 en 3 días, hice la devolución y me compre este...lo sigo comprando aquí porque es con una tarjeta de regalo que me dieron...ACTUALIZACIN AL 0/11/2021Compre otro XS de diferente proveedor “MOBO” segun en la caja viene que lo cerficican por no se cuantas funciones, pues resulto que el FACE ID no funcionaba, la pila al 86% bajo en tres dias al 82%. Lo devolvi y ya ne hicieron rembolsoEn resumen compre 3 iphone’s aqui en amazon un X que fallo el FACE ID, un XS con una pila de 76%, sin ninguna otra falla y otro XS Con falla en FACE ID y la pila… regrese los otros dos y me quedé con el de la pila al 76% mandare a cambiar la pila en aple store, lo cual me cuesta 1700, igual mucho mas barato que uno nuevo. Es una moneda al aire como puede salir bien como te puede salir mal, yo los compre aqui porque eran por tarjetas de regalo que me habia ganado asi que básicamente me costaron cero

El precio es justo con el producto que te están ofreciendo, la batería coincide con la descripción que te dan y el teléfono funciona al 100%. El cargador que te dan no es original pero por el precio lo compensa. Tiene algunos rasguos y un golpe en una esquina que no se notan a simple vista.

column1: Muy buen celular, pero dicen que la pila tiene de vida 80 o más, pero este tenía 78%
column2: Muy buen celular, buena atención del proveedor solo que dicen que tiene 80% mínimo de vida la pila y no es cierto, este tenía 78%
Compré un iPhone XS 256gb con el vendedor buyspry y llegó en perfecto estado, condición 9.5/10 con batería al 90%. Fue una buenísima compra , lo recomiendo totalmente.

Es un buen producto, llegó en excelentes condiciones el teléfono, pero me llegó con una capacidad máxima de 81% la batería por lo que se le acaba rápido la batería, debes de tener en cuenta que el equipo de por si de fábrica tenía una mala batería

column1: Batería menos del 80% de vida pero…
column2: El teléfono podría pasar como nuevo!, en estética pareciera que esta nuevo, tiene ligeros rasguos pero son casi imperceptibles, lo único malo es que el porcentaje de batería se encuentra en el 77%, pero en fin en precio y calidad no esta mal

Estaba muy contento con el teléfono, rápido, buena batería, cámaras y FaceID funcionales hasta que noté unos tonos verdes. Particularmente en colores obscuros. En pocas palabras, el display reproduce los grises obscuros como verdes obscuros. Incluso recién borrado conserva el problema. Dirán que "que payaso" pero en la noche desespera que todo tenga tono verde.Y que cuando cambio el volumen en youtube salga una barra verde a lo largo de toda la pantalla.. Estoy considerando de devolución del producto pero temo que me salgan con un "pero" :/
Producto bueno y sin detalle, me llego con batería al 100%, el único detalles que el cargador que viene es de muy mala calidad al mes dejo de funcionar.

Esta muy bonito y todo correcto estáticamente y por dentro en funcionalidad también lo que me desmotiva un poco fue el porcentaje de batería venía en 82% claro esta en las especificaciones que llevan arriba de 80% pero pues para lo que lo iba a utilizar no me sirve pero está excelente, volvería a comprar si no fuera por la batería
Llego en Perfecto estado y a dos meses de uso funciona perfecto
Llega lo que dice la publicación, estéticamente tiene un 9.5 y de batería llego con un 85% a ver que tal sale con el tiempo

El producto llegó bien estéticamente, lo único malo es que la batería deteriorada y al usarla se deterioro paulatinamente, así como también el cable de datos no funciono como lo esperaba, y los altavoces están daados y se escuchan mal.

El celular llego esteticamente perfecto, con la pantalla original, el unico punto negativo que le puedo dar es la bateria que llego al 83% pero con un uso cotidiano dura todo el dia. De todo lo demas el celular en excelentes condiciones.
Estaba un poco preocupado por el estado de celular pero está como nuevo sin ningún detalle estético, solo la.bateria que trae el 80% pero está muy bien el equipo.
Solo no me gusto el porcentaje de la bateria (84%)... De ahi en fuera todo muy bien, excelente estado fisico y la funcionalidad tambien al 100
Fast delivery. Product exactly as described. Battery life is good.

Estética de 8/10 con unos cuantos rayones a los lados, otro más super ligero en el cristal trasero, pero casi invisible, rinde como debería, la batería llegó con 83% de condición máximaEn resumen, el iphone cumple con lo descrito.

column1: Algo alto el precio para lo que es
column2: El dispositivo se encuentra bien, al parecer la pantalla fue cambiada más no se de mala calidad, la batería viene con 84% de vida algo gastada pero esta decente
Bien pour le prix la batterie est a 81%comme il dise
Lo compre tal vez un día de suerte en menos de 9 mil pesos, estética de 10, batería a un 82%, pero es lo de menos es un teléfono que desquita cada peso que inviertes, un mes y sin ningún problema.

column1: La pila no vino original y el touch se traba. Lo regresaré.
column2: La fecha de llegada y el embalaje BIEN pero el primer mensaje que salió cuando terminé de configurarlo fue que la batería no podía ser leída por no ser original. Al haber hecho investigación previa, sabía que es super común reemplazarlay que en general la batería se acaba rápido así que decidí quedarmelo y probarlo a pesar que la descripción dice: "Este producto tendrá una batería que supere el 80 % de capacidad en comparación con uno nuevo". En mi opinión la vida de la batería creo que es corta. Mi tiempo en pantalla es de 3-4h al día en redes sociales (poco cámara, cero juegos u otras apps) y al final del día se apaga.Su funcionamiento no es MALO, la cámara -que era de las razones principales por la que lo compré- funciona bien y por eso le di 3 estrellas, sin embargo a una semana de poco uso en general, me he dado cuenta que el touch se traba en casi todas las esquinas. Además de que me ha crasheado Whatsapp dos veces al mandar audios y me sale un mensaje diciendo que reinicie la app.El teléfono en general me gustó salvo por esos dos problemas que considero importantes y por lo tanto lo regresaré.

column1: Buen producto para el precio pagado
column2: La relación precio calidad me parece consistente, el celular llegó en muy buen estado. El estado de la batería estaba al 86%, cuiden bien su batería pero no deben de tener problema.
El producto está en buen estado tiene detalles en la pantalla y en el cristal de atrás que afectan la estética del producto pero de todo lo demás funciona muy bien
El teléfono llegó antes de la fecha programada, tiene unos ligeros rayones en un costado pero es lo de menos. La vida útil de la pila es del 92% así que está muy bien.

column1: Buen equipo, buen precio, mala descripción
column2: El artículo llegó casi como nuevo, lo único malo es que la descripción dice que llega con más del 80% de condición de batería y me llegó con 77% de condición de batería
Es cierto. Que a un brazo de distancia no se ven las imperfecciones pero si tiene cuando te acercas y la batería no viene en una muy buena condición (77%) yo esperaba un 85% 80% unu
Good but pricely
Batería casi al límite mínimo ofrecido y un poco rayado el entorno del teléfono
Llego en buen estado el iPhone XS de 64gb con 91% de batería. Pero lo que eh notado es que se me desgasta muy rápido la vida útil de la batería ya la llevo en 85% y apenas va un mes de uso.
Pequeos rayones en la parte de atrás, batería al 84% desde que lo compre excelente compra.

column1: Como nuevo, peor batería un poco mala.
column2: Todo súper bien, solo que la batería dura poquito, de ahí en fuera todo esta perfecto, parecía completamente nuevo.
Condición de batería al 91% tiene algunas imperfecciones de apariencia pero en general está en buenas condiciones
Como puedo hacer valida la garantia de 90 dias ?Mi micrófono no funciona muy bien. Se escucha muy bajito
Me llego en buenas condiciones solo esperaba un poco más de vida de la batería
Received on time, satisfied with performance
Se entrega lo que se oferta, estéticamente me llegó bien con batería en condición de 84%

column1: 83% battery capacity, expect to charge this phone a lot
column2: Battery capacity 83% upon delivery, battery died within three hours of limited use, within sellers minimum expectations but still a waste of money for $600. Would not recommend. My three year old iPhone SE at 80% capacity hold charges longer.

column1: Esteticamente muy bien pero no se escucha bien audio en llamada ni bocina inferior
column2: Esteticamente muy bien pero no se escucha bien audio en llamada ni bocina inferior, lo regresé, en espera del reembolso.Deberían hacer mas pruebas de funcionamiento, se esuchan las llamadas como si la personas estuviera dentro de un bote, y el audio de la bocina general la inferior se oye muy mal, si ves un video no lo entiendes, y la musica se oye mal.Mala suerte
Great quality for the price, and arrived before I expected

Según la etiqueta menciona la leyenda “nuevo” pero al abrirlo y inspeccionarlo note severos rayones en los bordes del iPhone, además de un deteriodo severo en la condición de la batería, y fallas en la pantalla derivado del touch, absolutamente no recomiendo comprarlo ya que con ese dinero es mejor opción buscar uno en Fb Marketplace usado y sale en mejor estado y más barato.
Buen equipo, aunque no haya traído el cargador original, trajo uno de carga rápida compensa ese detalle.
Casi en su totalidad, la bocina de escuchar llamadas, no se escucha con la suficiente claridad.

column1: l'appareil est dans un très bon état cosmétique, mais plusieurs défauts
column2: le GPS a fait défaut à quelques reprises, et le haut-parleur d’oreille est très faible, j'ai donc demandé de le retourner. La batterie affichait 86%, c'est raisonable, par contre le haut-parleur faible, ce n'est pas acceptable.

I’ve been using this phone for a week and I regret buying it. The sound is awful, it echos and sounds distorted at times both during phone calls and watching videos.The screen can sometimes stick when trying to unlock and calls will suddenly be switched to mute.
Buen aspecto del celular calidad precio lo recomiendo.
Estéticamente el cel luce bien pero llego con la batería más desgastada, solo retiene el 71%
Todo bien. La batería llego al 87%. Algunos pequeos detalles estéticos

L'écran tactile qui ne fonctionne plus au bout d'une semaine, et le réparateur qui ne dit qu'il y manque des pièces à l'intérieur. Vraiment cheap comme refurbished et pour 200$ de plus j'aurais mieux fait de prendre un nouveau! a me servira de leon!

Esteticamente el telefono esta impecable, sin embargo en la publicación menciona que vendrá con un centro de carga y cable genéricos, pero unicamente viene con el cable, adicionalmente el % de vida de la bateria es del 77% menor a lo que indican como mínimo

El producto se veia muy bien, pero presentaba los siguientes fallos-BOCINA frontal se oye defectuosa.- Está BLOQUEADO por su compaia de telefonía movil.- Vida de BATERIA al 77% y se calienta en desmedida con el uso y al cargar el celular.Vendedor: INNOVA LOHERTuve que pedir devolución, obviamente así no me servía.
físicamente bueno, mínimos rasgos de uso, recibido hoy , batería al 88% probando...
Un refurbished muy bueno en general.
estaba muy feliz con el equipo pero al poco tiempo de uso empezó a abrir aplicaciones solo y a escribir solo, así como desaparecían fotos, lo devolveré y comprare con otro proveedor

column1: COMPR ESTE ARITCULO PERO REQUIERO CAMBIO
column2: Adquirí este articulo y todo funciona bien excpeto que la calidad de imagen que tiene es muy mala, cualquier fotos ya sea desde la galería, facebook , navegador es muy mala se ven borrosas y no alcanza el hd en ninguna. Hastalos viedeos.Quisiera saber si me lo pueden cambiar por uno que si estpe correcta la pantalla ya que por lo que veo pudo haber sido reparado por la pantalla y esta no es la original ya que solo veo la opción de reembolso.
Traia unos ligeros rayonsitos atras, ya venia con mica protectora, pero con cargador generico y sin audifonos

Buen equipo con detalles estéticos pero funciona bienLos accesorios aunque trae son de mala calidadRelación calidad precio es la mejor aunq no contiene caja ni accesorios originales es muy buena compra
presentaba suciedad interna en el lente. esto provocaban que las fotos tuvieran leves manchas al inicio imperceptibles. Para ser re manufacturado se debió tener más cuidado

column1: No decepcionado pero si sin emoción.
column2: Un iPhone muy promedio, venía sin detalles en la pantalla ni en la parte trasera, traía muy maltratada la parte de abajo y las cámaras, se notaba que estaba abierto, le habrán echo una reparación.

column1: No lo suficientemente bueno para el precio pagado.
column2: Recibí un celular con 83% de rendimiento de batería. El equipo se sobre calienta mucho y hace que la carga del celular se esfume, la bocina para hacer llamadas suena distorsionada al punto de no entender que me comunican. A pesar de ser mi diseo favorito de iphone, regresaré el celular.

La batterie est vraimentde piètre qualité. Doit le recharger au trois quart de la journée avec un utilisation trèsmodeste. Est arrivéà 80 % de sa capacitéde recharge et un mois aprèsétait à 79 % Je ne pense pas faire 2 ans à ce rythme.

column1: Good deal, battery life only 83% life left
column2: The device was in great shape but I will likely have to replace the battery within the few months or so as it is only at 83%. This was rather disappointing as most of the reviews claim battery life anywhere from 90-97 percent.

After one day of use, the phone started to show signs of ghost touch. The phone would move around without being touched to the point where we could not control it. In the end, we had to return the product because the phone was unusable.
Muy buena calidad, un poco débil para las caídas, no tiene reforzadas las esquinas, poca protección en una caida del teléfono.

column1: Para el precio es una excelente compra siempre y cuando llegue bien el dispositivo
column2: Se calienta mucho necesito ver si es normal por la cantidad de procesos o tendré que regresarlo :( y traía un raspón en la pantalla está pequeo pero bueno lo trae
Returned the first phone purchased as camera would not go in silent mode.This phone arrived in excellent condition and works great!Looks brand new and all functions work!
El producto si tiene detalles estéticos. El lente de la cámara está estrellado, no afecta el funcionamiento. La pila está al 86% por lo cual se descarga muy rápido y se calienta :(

Al principio todo bien, solo que después de unos 5 meses el celular ya no prendió, y como es refurbished en apple no te lo pueden tomar otro celular por falta del ticket de compra, si tienen un poco más de dinero mejor compren uno nuevo y seguro
El celular llegó a tiempo y todo funcionando bien, pero al revisar el Audio se escucha saturado de ambas salidas de audio

El telefono venia bien fisicamente pero el lente de la camra trasera al tomar video aparecen lineas en el segundo lente del zoom digital es por eso que deolvi el producto estoy en espera de la devolucion de mi dinero
Llego con un poco de rallo es, sin audífonos ni cubo original, lo estoy probando y hasta ahora nada mal

column1: Pantalla inestable, brinca desde el arranque
column2: Decidí arriesgarme leyendo las reseas, en general leíreseas buenas y otra malas, aunque la mayoría se iban por las buenas con este vendedor. El producto llegó en el tiempo establecido y llegó exactamente lo que se pidió, el producto estéticamente estaba impecable y la batería al 100% (parecía de los teléfonos que te da apple cuando aplica garantía). El problema es que la pantalla brinca, responsiva al tacto, pero brinca sola. Es imposible usarlo así. Lo estoy devolviendo. Les actualizo como me va.
Capacité de batterie bas et était sale

column1: Celular con batería en malas condiciones
column2: La condición de la batería del celular está muy deteriorada, además de que ya tenía un golpe en el marco.
It came early… but also cam Defective !Could no Hear incoming calls.. !Sent it back!I think there quality control is very basic if any at all!Theses cell phones are hit and miss!

column1: Mala batería pero excelente estética y cuidado
column2: Todo bien con el celular, todo es original, lo único malo es que llego con 81% de batería

column1: Buen estado aunq la batería viene con 77%
column2: El equipo llegó rápido y está en buen estado pero su porcentaje de batería está al 77%

column1: Phone is good but heat issue
column2: The phone is great but during very basic tasks it gets very hot I’m debating on returning this.

column1: Buena estética, pila al 75%, bocina tronada
column2: El precio es bueno pero no cumple con el estándar de entregar la batería por arriba del 80%, el mío llego con 76% y la bocina tronada. No trae golpes ni rayones.

column1: Battery doesn’t even last until afternoon
column2: The battery sucks! It doesn’t charge to 100% and dies so quickly. I need to buy a new battery now…
El producto llego rápido sin embargo el Face ID venia defectuoso, tramite inmediatamente la devolución de mi dinero ya que no era lo que esperaba.

He comprado otros equipos renovados y me han salido de maravilla (al 100 de pila y de estética como nuevo)Pero este iPhone XS vino muy rayado de la pantalla. Y la condición de la batería estaba al 80%.
El cargador me duró menos de un mes.
el telefono llego "bien" sin detalle visual, la bateria llego al 82% como se dice en la descripcion, pero LA BOCINA esta daada, parece como si se la cambiaron o no se, espero respuesta :c

Estéticamente venía impecable, con batería al 88%. Realmente parecía un equipo nuevo pero lamentablemente en medio de la pantalla una línea de forma horizontal que atravesaba la pantalla no funcionaba. Como si fuera un tope o escalón. Fue eso y que de repente empezó a moverse sola la pantalla y a activar cosas que en ningún momento había tocado. En llamadas quería teclear un número y si aplanaba el 6 se activaba el 9 o 5.Mobo, se supone que revisan los teléfonos antes de vender. Esos detalles no creo que se puedan pasar por alto. Parece que les importa solo vender y no importa si tiene fallas el producto.
The battery drains too fast and it lags and the touch barely works
EL TELEFONO , NOS LLEGO RAYADO DE LA PNATALLA, EN UNA CAJA QUE NO ES LA SUYA Y CON UN CARGADOR GENERICO, BUENO EN SUMA NO ESTOYCONFORME !!
Me llego abajo del 80% de vida de pila, solo le duraba 4 horas y a los 3 dias de uso dejo de funcionar el touch de la pantalla, lo devolvi por estas razones, no los recomiendo

I purchased the phone from LuCells. The phone screen become not functioning and lock all my personal information. They were asking me to give them 5 star review to refund me and required me to give them my cellphone password so that once they replace the phone, they can reset it but there is my personal information inside. I refused and they started to complaint.

Me animé a comprar un equipo reacondicionado premium por la promesa de que llegaría en muy buen estado, desde el principio con el envío tardo en llegar y no podía rastrearlo con DHl cuando llegó el paquete venía muy mal protegido la caja de Amazon venía aplastada y por dentro venía la caja con el celular sin ningún tipo de protección, comencé a probar el celular y parecía como nuevo no tenía detalles visibles por eso me relajé, todo funcionó muy bien, pero a la semana de uso sin ningún motivo se apagó y ya no volvió a prender, inicié el proceso de devolución pero lleva ya una semana y no hay ningún registro de como va el envío ni como rastrearlo y temo por la devolución de mi dinero

column1: Equipo rayado en la pantalla y no retiraron la mica
column2: le colocaron una mica para ocultar ralladuras en la pantalla y trae otra con pegamento que no retiro el proveedor. Me percaté de las imperfecciones de la pantalla porque decidí retirar la mica protectora. El producto debe venir sin micas para que uno pueda revisar las condiciones del equipo y evitar ser engaados.

This product if a fake, likely channeled by the company producing it (or by some of their employees) through the grey market. The box and the user manual are the typical, disgusting Chinese attempt to mimic originals. The box says only "Lumia 635" using an improbable font and background color, without the usual Nokia or Microsoft logo or copyright disclaimers. The user manual is a poorly done scan of the original, and effectively unusable.If your moral is fine with supporting companies that abuse consumers and adopt such practices in the name of profit and greed, then the phone itself is a good bargain and mine came unlocked. BTW, those companies include in this case the Amazon reseller, and Amazon itself..I am going to return it as I don't want to be an accomplish in fraud.

column1: This is a Go Phone version that CANNOT RECIEVE SOFTWARE UPDATES!!! You will not be able to get WP10 when it releases.
column2: BEWARE!!! Users who want software updates do NOT buy this product.I receive the Go Phone version of the Lumia 635 with SKU S561A, which for some unknown reason AT&T is not allowing to receive the latest software update. The update has been out for store bought Lumia 635s with SKU S561 for over a month now, but in spite of both versions having identical hardware, nobody with the Go Phone version is able to update.This not only means that I cannot get the latest Windows Phone 8.1 update, which has a number of large improvements, but I will also not be able to get the Windows Phone 10 update when that comes out, as you must have the latest 8.1 update for it to work.If I wanted the Go Phone version of this I would have gotten it at Walmart for $15 cheaper.

column1: Don't waste your time and money.
column2: I have recently purchased three Nokia Lumia phones. One 530 and two 635's. I have had nothing but problems with all three. The 530 would not charge and would not boot. After finally getting advice from Microsoft, a master reset solved the problem. As for the two 635's, inserting the NANO Sim into the adapter and into the sim slot is VERY difficult. So difficult that I broke a sim connection prong in the process. Seating the Nano sim into the adapter is not easy and not always successful. That phone is now a paper weight. The second 635 would not charge, would not boot and repeated attempts at a master reset never worked. It showed signs of executing the reset but it never worked. I returned it for a refund.So, my experience with Lumia phones has been a disaster. I would not recommend this phone. The cheap price is not worth it. This is no bargain!

This is an upgraded version of Lumia 520.There is not quite much of a difference between these two models 520 and 635.This 635 has a larger screen than 520.Performance is great in terms of camera, wi-fi, touchscreen sensitivity, battery back up, etc.I highly recommend this product.

Awful experience with this phone.Right out of the box battery was inert, so I charged it fully overnight after inserting it in the phone using it's own branded charger and cord.Upon turning ON the phone it immediately displayed a Lightning Bolt and Cog.I did a bit of research and did the reset procedure vol dn, + power sw + camera buttons.It vibrated, I released the power button and the phone came up.Intermittantly it would drop into the Lightning Bolt/Cog business and require the reset procedure.Eventually I got to the update screen and saw there were updates available, so update it I did.Upon resetting itself after the 4 updates were completed it once again gave the Lightning Bolt/Cog screen and was non-responsive to the reset routine that previously worked.I removed the battery, removed the sim and extra memory card and allowed it to sit for an hour while I gathered more info from the net.Upon reassembling the battery, sim and mem card it powered on but did not respond to touch at all.I gave up at this point of that day and began to repeat all of this the next day...several times.What an awful piece of junk this phone was/is.I returned it to Amazon for a refund.

I love this cell phone, for the price that i paid for it and the functionality i needed from it is just fantastic. They reason i bought this cell phone is because what i really use it for mainly is for phone calls and text messaging, i dont run a online business or a big Facebook page on this phone but it is still very much capable of that. If there was any complaints from we for this phone would be that there has been some slip ups once or twice, for example a mobile game i had on my old iPhone before switching was Hill Climb Racing. For some reasons shortly after installing the game it would kick me off the game while using it. I don't know if that was my cell phone or the app but after i uninstalled it it never happened again. One thing that i absolutely LOVE about the Nokia Lumia 635 is the battery saver function, its nothing new and lots of phones have but the amount of battery this phone saves is insane. That functionality has three options, off, when battery is under 20% and always on. If i were to had it fully of i have 8 hours flat, if i use the under 20% option it does a bit of battery saving even before the 20 % and gives me a bit over 2 extra hours. And if you have it fully on it gives me 4 extra hours. I recommend this cell phone to anyone that is looking for a new phone but what i don't recommend is buying it from this seller, i bought mine from Walmart for 49.99 so 130.00 is way over priced.

column1: Best value for a high quality phone
column2: It is an excellent phone at a very reasonable price, thanks to subsidy by Microsoft. It is slightly bigger than iPhone 6 but at one tenth of the cost. It does most things you want on a smart phone flawlessly. Battery life is amazing. If you love YouTube, it is better than iPhone because you can easily down load YouTube videos and watch them on airplanes. The podcast function is better than Android as you don't have to buy an app to receive podcasts. The camera is quite decent as well.A couple of things to watch out for: Do not get a GO phone. It is locked. Unlocking it is impossible. Make sure you buy an unlocked phone. Selection of apps is more limited than either iPhone and Android. If you have a tablet with either IOS or Android, you have both covered.

column1: The Lumia 635, an ultra-reliable Windows phone with great features. Thoroughly recommended.
column2: UPDATE July 2019. Microsoft no longer supporting this phone, so WhatsApp won't work. Great shame, it's a nice simple and reliable phone, but now need to buy two new (Android) phones.This is our second Lumia 635. We still have the first, its about two and half years old now and still working absolutely perfectly. This second phone is for my wife. She had an Android before, but neither of us could get on with the over-complex home screen and operating system. (Update in June 2018 - our original phone is now four and a half years old! And still working perfectly.)The Lumia 635 runs Windows 8.1 - and its a total joy to use. Its so intuitive, easy and thoroughly logical. And the great things is - when you have two Windows phones, and Windows 10 PCs and laptops - all your contacts are automatically synchronised. Phone numbers, addresses, email addresses the same, immediately, on all devices. Its the perfect solution.UPDATE (June 2018). Windows 8.1 is still the latest Microsoft version of Windows for Phones. So this phone is still 100% current. Its still runs the latest version of WhatsApp too.One minor negative is Internet Explorer. Its too slow and bulky. I installed the Opera app which is MUCH faster and uncluttered. I recommend anybody to do the same.The phone has a USB port so I can transfer all my data to a computer, and the Nokia Suite app for Windows PC lets you manage the phone features too.Reasonable number of apps available for Windows too. And the Lumia 635 is a solid, well made phone that has lasted the course.Thoroughly recommended, and would definitely buy again. And if you also own a Windows PC or laptop, a Windows phone is the logical choice. Microsoft have really got the integration sorted. In fact I would not buy another Android - Windows is far better.

column1: Give it a go.  You won't regret it!
column2: Really happy with this phone.Have always used Android until now but thought I'd give this a go as the write ups andreviews were good,I wasn't disapointed. It's a nice size, looks good and works well.It's really easy to set up as from the moment you switch on it takes you through all the stages including emails and contacts.There's also loads of features built in that make it a really useful piece of tech and all the time it's really easy to use.If your using windows on your PC then this is just an extension of that and works well when connected to your PC.The only criticism such as it is, is it lacks a "Silent" button, you have to turn the volume down to put it on silent.I minor detail really. It's said that there isn't the number of apps available compared to IOS or Android but so far I managed to find all the apps I need.To sum up, if like me you don't want to be yet another zombie with an Apple phone or you fancy a change from Android then this is the phone for you.I can highly recommend.One more thing, a major feather in a very nice hat, you don't have to worry about viruses as apparently there aren't any (Yet) for window phones.Food for thought.

I've had company phones for many years but, having retired, had to do a bit of research before purchasing.Being a windows phone, very easy to sync with my other devices.It's a good size, very easy to use and has the functionality one would expect for a phone in this class.Battery life has been excellent.Very pleased.

This phone is great for an oldie like me, not too complicated, good clear screen and takes lovely pics. I had a Noikia Lumia before but unfortunately I dropped it so I went back to a basic Nokia, I then realised that I missed the ease of being able to type text with an onscreen keyboard rather than the laborious, old fashioned way using the keypad. This may not be an all singing, all dancing up to the date gadget but it suits me and was at a sensible price, so if I do drop it, it wont be the end of the world. I have invested in a heavy duty jacket so hopefully any clumsiness should not prove catastrophic the next time.

I'm really liking this phone.I'm changing over from a HTC Wildfire (which is probably 3-4 years old now) and don't have a lot of experience of smartphones, so this review won't be particularly technical!Things I like:- it starts up very quickly- Word Flow typing and its predictive text are really good - very few errors, esp. compared to what I am used to.- graphics are very fluid, sliding from one screen to the next is almost pleasurable!- I like the calendar - easy to use and view.- it's a Nokia!Always liked the regular Nokia phones - hard-wearing and intuitive to use.I'm pleased Nokia are getting up to speed with Smartphones.- I like the sound and picture quality when streaming (I've only used over WiFi not mobile internet).Things I think Nokia/Windows could improve:- Available Apps.There are a lot of apps out there, but there are a few that I haven't found, e.g. ColorNote (although Office's OneNote is coming in handy as a replacement).Of course, this may not actually be down to Nokia/Windows but the people who actually develop the apps.- I think the settings menu could be tidied up a little.- The phone doesn't have a flash...but most photos seem to come out OK.I suppose it depends on the environment, and ultimately, if you are used to a phone that is just a phone, you will still be pleased with the camera.Camera is easy to use.- Both this phone and the previous smartphone I have used need the phone to be switched on for the alarm to work.I loved the days when I could save battery life by switching the phone off at night yet still knowing the alarm would go off.I have a feeling this is true of all smartphones and I guess it's to do with everything being an "app" these days, but it would be nice if there was some way of getting the alarms to work when the phone is off (I'm sure there is such a way!).I'm used to using Alarm Clock Xtreme, which has a lot of settings for snoozing, etc (terrible habit, I know!).Can't find the app for this phone, so am using the standard alarm.Snooze time is 10 min.Things I've worked out that maybe, like me, not everyone will know when moving to this phone:- to take a screenshot, press both side buttons simultaneously (I'd never known how to take screenshots on a phone before)- to customise your Home screen, press on a tile and they all begin to 'float'.You can remove, change the size and move tiles to suit your needs.To add a tile from your apps list, press down on the app entry and then select Pin to Start.- Quite a few of the pre-installed apps (which more often than not I tend to find aren't necessary for my use) can be uninstalled.I don't know if they are truly uninstalled or just go hiding somewhere, but it helps to reduce the number of apps I have to scroll through on my app list.- hold down the <- arrow to view all the windows you have open.At first I was annoyed that I couldn't, say, come out of a google search without having to repeat the search...then I discovered this function!Not the tidiest of reviews, I admit, but I hope this helps people who are moving over to the Nokia Lumia models.I'm really pleased I have made the move, and really like this phone.For the price, I don't think you could expect more really (I've seen the cost of higher spec models and iphones, etc.!) - this phone does a hell of a lot and nicely too :-)I guess these days, mobile phones are less about being phones and more about being everything you need whilst on the go!EDIT - forgot to say, it doesn't come with a USB cable if you want to connect to PC - I haven't got that far yet!I paid £119 on 12/09/14.Arrived on SUNDAY (!) 14/09/14.Great delivery service.Was sold by Amazon when I purchased.

column1: Good value for money Windows phone
column2: The phone is excellent value for money and arrived really quickly.I had a Nokia Lumia 925 before this which I absolutely loved, but I dropped it and broke it after about 18 months.I wanted to get another Windows phone and I always like Nokia phones.I chose this one based on the price and it has everything I want from a phone.The one thing about it that I am a bit disappointed with is that it does not have a forward facing camera.I knew this when I bought it, and I would not normally need to have a forward facing camera, but when I tried using Skype I realised that this is a problem.However, I would still recommend this phone if you want a good, easy to handle, Windows phone.

column1: Initially a really nice phone  - until it stopped working properly
column2: UPATE AFTER 9 MONTHSThe phone has now decided it no longer wants to connect to wifi.The only way it will connect is if I take the battery and sim out and then replace the battery only.Returned to Amazon for refund. I have had this phone for 2 weeks now and I am very happy with it.The battery is excellent.On low usage it lasts 3 days.Yesterday I played a game for 10 minutes; used Viber on and off throughout the day; browsed the web for about 10 minutes; checked the news about 5 times; checked weather 4 times; downloaded and printed 3 documents and downloaded 3 apps, and at the end of the day it was at 50%.I like the Windows software very much, I prefer it to Android as it is slicker.OK you do not get anywhere near as many apps as on Android but I brought the phone to use as a phone not a games console.If there is not an app for your favourite site (such as Amazon) you can just add a shortcut to the website to your start screen.Sound is excellent as is signal strength.I have previously owned Xperia, Galaxy and HTC phones but I am far happier with this one than any of them.All in all a very good phone especially given the price.

I have had a Nokia 635 for about two years; I bought the current one for my wife, who has never used a mobile phone.It was good to have two identical phones (although this one has some differences in software).She didn't want one that was too complicated, and is finding it straightforward to use.The important point is that it does what it says on the tin; not much in the way of frills, Windows 8.1 isn't the most exciting operating system, but who cares?It does what I expected and what we both need.Quite quick (4G), we don't often lose signal, and it just keeps on doing what we ask of it.Very cheap too, for what it offers.Good battery life: a friend has one of another make, and he has to carry a top-up battery, because it won't run for a day.Not so the 635; even after a day of texting/emailing, looking up things on the internet, it is usually still around 40%charge.If you aren't worried about all the latest bells whistles and frills, I can recommend this phone.If you want the latest and greatest, well, it's not for you.

This has been a reliable and robust phone which I use mostly for checking work emails and for sat nav. I say robust because my 1 year old son has taken a shine to it and as a result it has been dropped numerous times. The back usually pops off but snaps back on easily enough.Obviously I do use it as an actual phone sometimes and for this it is fine, although it does seem to get pretty hot against the ear. Sound quality is normal.Battery life seems comparable with other phones but I do have most apps switched off which helps. Probably needs charging every day but I think that is how things are now with smartphones.The camera is not great and is quite slow. There is no flash which is a shame. It's OK for snappy snaps though. Storage seems OK but again I do make a habit of deleting things. The function to upload photos automatically to One Drive is useful/very useful.WiFi and browsing seem OK but it does struggle with certain newpapers' websites for some reason. It's not super fast.Email usability seems good and I use it on Outlook and Yahoo mail. Both work well.The sat-nav is characteristically excellent and is another reason why I keep getting Nokias (now Microsoft).The only other app I really use a lot is Audible which works well. The sound quality is pretty tinny but one expects that for the price.Overall a very good value 'phone that does the job I need it to do.

column1: Good phone that lasted me 2 years
column2: This is a 13 year old writing on a parent's account. I will say that I got this phone 2 years ago and it has not lagged at all (which surprises me as I used to have androids which have lagged loads), it has an alright camera, although not the best, and it can do daily tasks smoothly.A few downsides to while I had this phone though-No front facing camera-Sometimes apps closed randomly, but it was rare, about twice a week I would say-Its windows OS, so some apps that you can normally get on Android aren't available (such as Snapchat or latest games that come out on iOS or android)I have changed over to an iPhone 7 now and obviously the two aren't compareable, but the phone feels a bit old now and extremely small.

Bought this for my husband: absolutely fantastic phone for the price. Quick, easy software, intuitive (esp if you have a windows PC). Bought 64GB expansion card - could load + 4000 songs and plenty space left. Feels very good quality in the hand. ONLY drawback is no front facing camera, so no easy selfies. I am buying another Windows phone again (for myself when my ABSURDLY expensive iphone gives up - let's free ourselves from the Apple choke hold, and I am never spending ~£500 on a phone again as long as phones like these are on the market).

column1: Excellent phone for the price remember that when missing the ...
column2: Excellent phone for the price remember that when missing the rear looking camera and the very plastic finish becomes apparent. Also note though I couldn't find it in any documentation that if you want to add a memory card after initial set up you need to reset the phone with it fitted before it will recognise it losing any setup or apps installed. I was on the point of sending the phone back when as a last resort I did a reset just to see if my new 64gb card would work as nothing else had worked and it did frustrating reding all the setup and downloads again.

Bought this to replace a Samsung Galaxy ace so I'm new to windows phones although other members of the family have them.Didn't take very long to get used to the windows system and I love it, preferring it to android. It has fluid movement on the screen with a lot more battery life than I've been used to. It's larger in size than the ace but it's easy to hold in one hand. For me it's value for money but I'm no techie so I'm sure there are some issues but they probablywon't bother me too much as long as I can message and text I'm happy!

column1: I have now been able to get a much better phone (Samsung - never going back to Windows
column2: No front camera. No flash on rear camera. Camera diabolical. Cannot download anything through the store that you could for Android. Impossible to download Google Play - Windows does not allow it. No Amazon music - which stores all music ever purchased through Amazon (for me - a lot). Phone was also faulty. Thought battery faulty when I got the phone. Amazon kindly credited my account to purchase a new battery, but same problem. Tried my battery in friend's identical phone, my battery in his phone lasted over a week and theirs in mine less than a day. 7 months later the phone started crashing on me and turning itself off. Called Amazon who amazingly offered a full refund as they could see from their notes that I had been having problems from the beginning. Thank you Amazon. I have now been able to get a much better phone (Samsung - never going back to Windows. I'm Android through and through)

column1: The 635 is a perfect size; slim and lightweight with great graphics and ...
column2: I have to admit that I was a little skeptical about buying this phone, especially considering the price tag and the Windows operating system. I have an iPhone 4s which I use for work and wanted something else for personal use.The 635 is a perfect size; slim and lightweight with great graphics and a vivid color display which is better than the iPhone (in my opinion) in direct sunlight. I like the fact that I can individualize the home screen and have an up to date basic view of all applications (email, calendar and social media etc) without having to open each of them individually. The camera produces good quality pictures and has some nice options for shooting in different modes/scenes.Battery life is very good for a smart phone. It can survive a full day of pretty heavy usage and charges fairly quickly too.My only gripe (and I'm picking to be constructive) is that it's not quite as responsive as my iPhone. Some of the applications take a second longer to load and there is no front camera, which in all reality, I never use anyway!Overall, excellent value for money.

column1: Futuristic; with one foot firmly in the PAST
column2: Been using this for over a month now, and do you know what?I prefer it to the iPhone 4s that I had before.I would have given it 5 stars without hesitation, however, when uploading, or trying to upload, a photo to Twitter; it puts it on sideways; with no option to rotate!!?Very frustrating.So the picture has been taken normally, and if you try and send on email, or add to any other program - it's fine.Twitter?It goes all wonky.BTW the camera is properly RUBBISH, unless you're in daylight, and your surname is Bailey, forget it.Also, while still in the Twittersphere, this phone DOES NOT play gifs (those little video clips that last about 6 secs or so), which are all over Twitter, and I USED to enjoy:Haha, that guy just fell over, while pushing a wheelbarrow and his head went in all the horse-muck scenario.Not anymore.Now the guy just stands there with his wheelbarrow; motionless.It's nowhere near as funny.If you live for Twitter - WALK AWAY.Otherwise, this is truly an excellent phone, very usable, great functions, really easy to import your contacts - even from a fascist iPhone/Apple product.I remember when I got the iPhone 4s and it wouldn't let me import my contacts from my HTC and I had to do it manually.This phone did it by Bluetooth in under 2 minutes.It's also recently done an update and given me that Ford Cortana personal assistant thingmy that we're seeing all over the TV adverts, and which a gaming geek pointed out comes from a game called Halo?Anyway, for under £100 delivered, it's pretty awesome dudes.

column1: Keys not working - Had to return
column2: I will be returning this mobile because unfortunately the keys on the left hand side Q, A & the two keys below did not work when the mobile was held in a vertical position. When I turned it round to landscape the image did not turn round. This phone claims to go landscape. I checked it was set correctly to do this. However, I found that sometimes it changed. sometimes not. The main problem was that I needed to sign into Microsoft. I could not do this because the above keys would not work when the mobile was held vertically. I did a factory reset twice. I tried resolving it through the Nokia website which I must say was very comprehensive. I could not get this problem solved despite hours trying all sorts of possible solutions. Obviously the phone is just faulty. I will not be asking for a replacement. I recently bought a Kindle Fire and in comparison in navigation, ease clarity of screen etc the KF is far superior to this Nokia 635. Obviously, if all the keys had worked I would have kept the phone.It was very good value at half price.

column1: It's good but it's not quite Calling.. (two-way skype video calling that it)
column2: It's cheap, that's a good start, it has 4G - so for tethering that's also good. Screen resolution and camera are okay for the price. My biggest gripe (apart from the obvious lack of certain apps - notably catchup TV - RTE here in Ireland (not sure about BBC iPlayer?) is the lack of a front-facing camera - even basic doid tablets have this and given it's 4g-ness it seems an odd oversight because the res tells you you are mostly going to use this for social and email. Bit of bonus is HERE maps - which I believe has turn-by-turn gps-asssisted navigation - from that point of view and as a hotspot it's worth the money. Personally I sent it back and headed for the 735 - which is notably snappier and has front-facing camera - it is however substantially dearer (not silly dear compared to 'smart' phones (honestly I think android is terrible!)) but a bit more futureproof - I anticipate this living in the glovebox as a GPS/media device and 4g hotspot for the next few years - things you could also do with the 635 come to think of it..!

column1: Battery life or lack of it
column2: The item was bought for my mother. The phones an old model and was second hand or reconditioned however the model wouldn't hold it's charge. The phone was in battery saver mode limiting its functionality the usual battery drains were off like brightness or being in stand by mode too long wi-fi or Bluetooth but in idle it would simply eat it's charge quickly. Leaves you thinking is the handset faulty as you've taken every step to reserve it's life but it still drains fast. It's a nice looking phone but that feature lets it down sadly.

Great value Windows smart phone. Easy to set up and use. I bought mine from RMA Technologies, which was fulfilled by Amazon. Brand new in original packaging. Comes with basic instructions in English, battery, earphones, USB charger. It needs a micro SIM. I also put a 16GB micro SD in mine. It has 8GB on board storage (where the OS is), and can take up to 128GB extra. The operating system takes you through all the steps to set it up (in English). It's Windows 8, and when you go online it will automatically download the 8.1 update. You can then tweak all your apps and personal settings to your taste. I did find that the keyboard settings, and the speech for Cortana were set to Spanish, but all you need to do is change them to English. (The speech had to download, which you then need to tap to install, and then restart the phone). It cannot upgrade to Windows 10 due to the hardware limitations. I already have a Lumia 610 dating from about 2012, and I just wish I could afford the top models!

column1: Of course the network providers love it - they can bill me for a load ...
column2: The biggest problem with this phone is that you have to go back to the home screen before switching off and I often forget. So, if I've just finished a call and switch the phone off (or rather put it in sleep mode), there's a big risk of re-dialing the person I've just called while the phone is in my pocket.I get the same thing happen to me - someone rings and all I can hear is voices or muffled sounds in the background. When I eventually get to talk to them I ask what handset they've got and guess what - it's always a Nokia! So I'm not the only one. Of course the network providers love it - they can bill me for a load of calls I didn't intend to make.

Update 12/30/17:After a little over 2 years, I've pretty much come to the end of the product's useful lifespan.I've been deleting apps for months, just to be able to keep the core functions updated.Now,however, I can't even do that. A couple of updates ago, Firefox was no longer able to move to the sd card & that was rely the beginning of the end. I'd not have loadedthat app, but about a year ago (I. guessing), HTC stopped supporting the browser the phone came with, so I had to go get anew one.Really stupid, IMHO.Anyway, the only other serious issue I found was that the camera is *terrible* in even moderately low light conditions. The video is even worse. Otherwise, I've found both to be pretty good, especially for the price.I'm actively looking for a replacement, but so far VM doesn't have much I'm interested in, without spending a boat-load of money. I don't intend to accept a downgrade of any of the features, but I can't afford $500 for a new phone. So the search continues...I've only had this phone for about a day & a half, so I may update this review as I learn more about the product.So far, I like it.I don't love it, but then, it's just a phone.I still miss one of my old flip phones from many, many years ago that, ironically, cost about the same as this one (roughly $150).It had the best reception of any cell I've ever used, bar none.The camera was excellent, considering how long ago it was.The phone was extremely durable as well, and had I not dropped it just one too many times & dislodged the camera lens, I'd likely still be using it.In any case, this HTC is my first personal smart phone.I've previously had an iPhone 4 & 5C for work.The 5C was an 8GB model, so I find this HTC phone to be fairly comparable, with one huge difference: the screen size.I've got small hands, but haven't had any issues with this monster yet.It has taken a bit of getting used to, but I find that to be the case with any new item, when you're used to something else.I've had more "trouble" getting used to the android way of doing things than with handling the phone itself.But again, that's just from being completely unfamiliar with the android product line.I do look forward to seeing what it can do.It's a bit less intuitive than Apple's OS, but I do have to say that when I first started using the iphone 4 for work, I wanted to throw it out a window at least once a day.We eventually reached a truce, however, and I'm hoping it will be the same with the HTC.First impressions:It's big.Not so big that it won't (mostly) fit into a pocket, but it's quite a jump up from a 4" screen.I'm attaching a pic of the two phones for size comparison.The HTC will definitely stick out lengthwise from a back pocket.The ringtone choices are limited & pretty sad, but you're able to record your own, so I likely will do so.As others have said, it's got 8GB of storage, and about half that is taken up by pre-loaded software.That seems pretty standard, however, and I'd already planned to pick up an SD card to increase space sooner rather than later.That's not an option with the 5C (or any iphone), so that's a point in this phone's favor.Call clarity is ok, but not nearly as good as either iphone.It's really only about as good as my current VM flip phone, which is at least 5 or 6 years old, maybe more (

I've had this phone for over a year and I can't update any apps anymore because the internal storage is full. I only have 3 or 4 personal apps installed because there's absolutely no room for anything but the bare minimum. Even if you move apps to an SD card, they automatically move back to your phone's internal storage when they update. The most I can do is have photos I take with the camera saved to it. I have a 60 gig SD card that is mostly empty because I can't install apps to it! There is tons of bloatware that clogs up the 5 gigs of internal storage you do get. At this point I haven't updated most apps in over 6 months and I have to run a cleaning app every time I want to update something just to see if I can make enough room. Had to uninstall Instagram and Facebook just to update Snapchat. If I want to install anything new I'll have to uninstall Twitter or Spotify. This phone is no good.

Purchased this phone because of the great reviews but it was a big disappointment. It does have a great screen size for watching Youtube and playing games. My son really enjoyed that. It takes great pictures and videos and they come out crisp and bright. It also has great speakers and we enjoyed lots of Amazon music on it. However I could not really use the speakers when talking on the phone. People could not hear me clearly and the phone would cut out lots of the conversation. A big annoyance because you would have to hold the phone the whole time and can't do anything else. I also found the placement of the power buttons and the volume buttons on the left top side to be really inconvenient. I don't have big hands at all and I was consistently turning off my screen. It caused me to lose lots of great photo ops the worse one being the shot of my son receiving his First Holy Communion! The deal breaker for me is the incredibly low memory storage this phone has. Most of the memory is taken up by useless apps that come with the phone and you can't get rid of them. I have only been able to download three apps and there is no more storage left! I am constantly moving stuff to my SD card but they keep ending up back in internal storage. I disabled some of the preloaded apps, i blocked updates and I am constantly having to clear the cache but it is a never ending struggle because it has to be done so often. I was without my Messenger app for a while because there was not enough memory to update it! The memory issue with this phone is such a disappointment that I cannot recommend it for purchase and I really want to give it two stars for the frustration it causes!

With a new phone purchase looming on the horizon, this seemed like a great opportunity to look back on this phone of mine.I bought this back in 2015 when I switched to Virgin Mobile and it has been a solid phone for all that time.Pros:-Size, while initially seeming a bit large, grew on me and I was never want for more screen space.-Speakers are quite good by cell phone standards-Sturdy, I have dropped this phone multiple times over the past 4 years and it's still working just fine.No screen breakage or anything.-Main camera is still great even by today's standards.It's understandably going to be outclassed by Google Pixels, Galaxy S9/10s, and whatever new iPhone out there, but that's not to say that it doesn't still take good photos.-In-camera photo editing software is quite good and satisfied my needs.-Call quality was always more than fine.Any issues regarding cell service or cell coverage would be a fault of the carrier, Sprint (ie. Virgin Mobile), and not this phone.Cons-Bluetooth connectivity completely failed about 6 months ago.Despite my best efforts, this phone will no longer connect to any bluetooth devices.-Headphone jack somehow got "stretched out", no longer securely holds headphones.I can still connect my headphones or earbuds to the phone and the audio works just fine, but even the lightest pull will pull out the headphone cable from the phone.-Internal storage in this phone is a joke.Box said 8GB, but bloatware will give you only about 4-5GB.This has resulted in an almost comical juggling of apps on my phone, trying to decide which ones to keep, which ones to delete, and which ones to allow to update.-Android updates, as expected, no longer happen.Any sort of updates on this phone are a thing of the past.-Low-light/night photos, despite all of this phone's camera's strengths, it never really did well when it came to night photography.Too much noise for my liking.-Limited memory meant that programs and apps could get bogged down and slow from time to time.Don't expect all apps to open quick and snappy.-The phone's screen has begun to flicker every now and then (began about 6 months ago).It's not often, but occasionally I'll get a screen full of lateral static lines that appear to overlay and dim my screen.It's not elegant, but I've found a quick, firm knuckle tap to the back of the phone snaps everything back to normal.So all in all, this has been a solid phone.With age, it has gotten a bit long in the tooth and it's definitely showing its age now.But considering I bought this phone primarily to be a secondary camera for when I didn't want to carry around my DSLR, I'd say it did its job just fine.It made calls when I needed it to make calls, texts worked just fine, the camera filled my memory cards with great photos, and 4 years later it's still working and doing what I ask of it.

Too many good detailed reviews, so i will just post likes/dislikes.Likes:+Big good looking 5.5" screen that still fits easily in my work pants/slacks.+Built in boom sound, zoe and visual equalizers with lyrics for your music.+Plays your mp3s from your burned cds, not just official mp3s bought online.+in general: good cameras, phone features and smooth operation.+Can transfer pics and video from your sd card to built in storage and vice versa at will(only about half of the 8gb of internal storage is usable though, but most of my music and videos are on the sd card anyway.Disclaimer: im not a heavy user of apps and i dont game on a phone)Dislikes:-very heavy usage means charging daily, and it doesnt exactly charge fast.But im usually able to charge every other day.-boom sound is good and loud close by, but it doesnt really sound that loud from a long distance to me.other budget phones ive had sound louder from a distance.-gets kinda hot with extensive usage on certain activities to the point where i added a widget that indicates battery temp.-phone still fits in my pants, shorts, etc.But im always worried it might break when i bend at work(manual labor).Not exactly premium materials used(but hey its a budget phone & price at 180 with no contract)Anyway, your mileage will vary with above plus & minuses.I bought at $180(wiped out $80 in amazon credit so it ended up only costing me $100), dont regret it at all.Months ago i was looking to upgrade to a 5" sharp aquos but virgin mobile never made that available(us vm'ers get the short stick since we are 3rd in line behind sprint prepaid and boost i guess).But thats ok, im glad im "stuck" with this phone.And at the rate virgin is adding new phones to its line up(which seems like forever), i would gladly buy another on sale as a backup or recommend this as an upgrade to anything but the s5.

column1: Only choice for VM for low price high specs...BUT, problems ensue.
column2: **Firstly, this is the only choice you have for high specs and low price on virgin mobile. So there really is no reason to not get it.**Alright now that you accepted that fact lets state the flaws you wont notice right away and what makes me give this 3 stars after over a year of owning it. Keep in mind I have large hands (im 6'4'') so youd think i would like a bigger phone, right? Wrong.1. The actual screen to body ratio is pretty poor. Theres a large border around the screen, the speakers take up a lot of space, the stupid logo has its own row, and the navigation buttons are on screen which doesnt count as usable space. The screen seems MUCH smaller after realizing what you have to actually work with.2. I didnt think it would be a problem with the power button being above the volume buttons but i absolutely hate this. I mean HATE. Im not left handed so turning the screen on and off requires finesse with your pointer finger to not lose grip of the phone and throw it. Ive done this a lot and like i said before, i have large hands so i cant imagine an average sized person doing this without always using both hands to hold the phone and push the button. this sort of required finesse also applies to typing text with 1 hand, it wont happen.3. Camera is very poor and grainy in low light. Otherwise it is pretty standard.4. I previously owned a Samsung Galaxy S3 (also virgin mobile) and will say the colors on that phone blow this phone away. it was pretty underwhelming looking at this phone until i finally forgot what the s3 looked like.5. 8 gb internal storage with unremovable bloatware means hardly any real world storage space. After system updates, HTC sense junk updates, you will be scouring your phone for things to delete just so you can install the next major system update. My galaxy s3 had 16gb...how is this newer phone half the space?6. A general wrap-up on the size of the phone. Since the screen is 5.5 in, with a large bezel surrounding it the phone is much larger than youd think. i constantly drop or throw (like a bar of soap) this phone because it isnt practical to hold with 1 hand. Im sorry, im getting older and i feel dumb standing in 1 spot with both hands on the phone for everything i do like im in the 3rd grade staring at the davinci code trying to figure out a great mystery. This phone is just too damn large for how much usable screen space there is. Also, having this in my jeans pocket is very uncomfortable and i always take it out if i go out to eat.7. This is the biggest issue. The simm card slot on these phones is very poorly manufactured. After a few times of dropping the phone, the spring mechanism that "snaps" and holds your simm card in place will break. This causes the simm card to never be able to properly stay in the slot. bought a hard plastic slim case that sort of smashes the sim card into the slot and keeps it in place. So now i can never remove this crappy plastic case or else the simm card shoots out of my phone. This issue is well known if you look it up. I was going to repair it myself but the simm card assembly is contact soldered to the main board which requires a special heatgun. If you get any parts too hot your phone is perma fried. So now sometimes my internet just drops out and says "cannot establish a wireless connection" and i have to hold the upper right corner of the phone where the simm slot is to regain connection.7-2. So because the phone is too large, you drop it, simm card slot breaks. There is no amount of being careful in the world where you WONT drop your phone. it is inevitable.8. With the latest system software updates the phone now randomly has a restart loop (seems completely random but it happens on google maps a lot) and will lock up on the HTC logo screen. Unless you wait for your battery to die the only way to regain control of the phone is to rip the back of the "non removable" backing off. Then, with a tiny flat head screwdriver pry UP on the battery cables/pin that connect the battery to the power board. Push the connector back into the pins, and snap the backing plate back on. Power on phone. This problem actually happens a lot and is very random as to what causes it.9. Turn off location services unless you like a lot of errors popping up saying "google everything has stopped working" Turn on location services when you want to use GPS.That is the end of the review. I hope this helps with some people who do not want those "star struck reviews". This is a real world, normal person with a job account of the problems ive found over the last year+ with the phone.

column1: No More Ridiculously Overpriced Smartphones! This One is Fine!
column2: Pros :-It's a phone that costs 129.00 and has no contract. A no brainer when you compare it to the Samsung Galaxy S4s my wife and I had that had to be replaced 2 times (that's both phones 2 times) because they had problems with thinking the SIM card had been removed and made you reboot them. Not something I want to be dealing with when I have to pay over $600 EACH. Factor in the insurance in case you damage them, if you try to use that insurance your Co-pay is still more than the cost of a brand new HTC Desire so why even bother? It's all just a scam to keep you paying ridiculously high monthly cell phone bills until the day you die. Making it worse my FORMER cell phone provider tried to make me pay 400.00 for one of the first 2 Galaxy phones we exchanged claiming charge port damage. Utter BS and I got that bill eliminated. Buying a phone outright and paying as you go is now the only plan I will ever be on.- It has front facing stereo speakers that sound quite nice, another advantage to that is those speakers make it easier to hear incoming calls and texts if you work in a noisy environment like I do.-You can put up to a 128GB SD card in for additional storage(unlike overpriced iPhone garbage and the newest Samsung products)-13MP rear and 5MP front cameras (720P on the Video, same as screen resolution)-EXCELLENT battery life, however charging takes longer even when I use a 2amp charger instead of the 1amp it comes with-It doesn't cost over 600.00 like samsungs and iPhones! Cons:- it doesn't have dual band Wi-Fi-if you can do without social media like I can, Facebook and Twitter are pre-installed and you can't get them uninstalled, you can turn them off but you can't recover the storage they are hogging up-only 160 character texting so longer texts will be split into multiple texts, not sure if it's because of the phone itself or if it's a Virgin Mobile thing-Non Removable battery. If I have to have it professionally replaced in a few years I've still come out far ahead $ wise compared to the prices of Samsung and apple products that are ridiculously overpriced IMO (you can still hold in power button to reboot if any apps lock your phone up)-Some would say 720P resolution is a con but if you think about it that is still a lot of pixels crammed into a 5.5 inch screen. In my opinion, it takes a much larger screen like at least that of a 32 inch lcd television before you really begin to notice differences in 720P and 1080POverall very happy with the purchase. The quad core processor keeps things moving quickly but I'm not one to put a lot of apps on my phone either, I use my Tablet for that

Update: After owning this phone now 8 months I hate it! Today I noticed that my phone hadn't updated 18 apps. So being like a normal breathing human I went to update it only I couldn't. It only allowed me to update 5 apps before being informed that I was out of memory. This was after I had spent 20 minutes clearing out my cache and removing 3 apps. These are the basic apps that come with the phone and if the phone doesn't have the memory to even update it then what's the point of this phone even?! It's exhausting with this phone. Save your money and get a better one!!!I have enjoyed this phone for almost 2 months now. I thought coming from the Samsung S3 I wouldn't be able to adjust from the 4.8inch screen to the 5.5inch screen, that it would be too big. Once I got the phone though I never even noticed how much bigger the screen was. I feel in love with. The colors are bright and the picture is very clear. My only problem with the phone is that when in the sunlight the screen is hard to read. Its very washed out. Also the memory on the phone sucks. I bought a 32gb card to go with the phone but even after moving the apps that would let me move them to the card, I still only have 7.68gb left on the phone storage. That makes it hardto update the apps that need updated. Of course it's a Virgin Mobile phone so it's a lot of worthless apps I don't need.

column1: 2yrs old and still going strong. But wont hold a lot of apps.
column2: I have had this phone almost two yrs now it is a great phone pictures where great but now are becoming blurry some days still good other days looks like I went from cold to hot and has a haze over them. touchscreen still in great shape no problems. Virgin Mobile apps that are pre program sucks can't get rid of them like you could on the older versions of their phones even with an SD card of any size it will only let you put some of the things on there internal space gets taken up very early and you cannot update. I have been able to do a system update and I am on a higher Android lollipop and it did give me some pictures in the camera Department like Photo Booth and split screen which are very cool I love this phone because it has dual front-facing speakers and is much louder than any of the other Virgin Mobile phones I have had in the past I am having trouble with the sync program but only in the last few months. overall with the 5.5 inch screen dual front speakers 13 megapixel camera in the back and five megapixel camera in the front I say that this phone is an overall great product from Virgin Mobile and Amazon originally paid $196 for it. I have been shopping around but cannot find a phone that had a 5.5 screen for the cameras today I found that the LG stylus 2 maybe what I am looking for cannot find information on speakers will not go back to a non dual speaker phone. I love playing Amazon music and watching videos and the speaker hands down beats any other phone I have owned.also I should say that if you are a gamer or like to have a lot of apps this phone is not for you.it comes with too much stuff created from Google that will not let you install it and it eats up a lot of the memory.

column1: My Initial Thoughts On This Phone
column2: I've activated and been playing with this phone for the better part of the day, so my experiences so far may be 'incomplete' compared to how I may feel given some more time with it....but here goes:This is my first new phone in 3-4 years. My last phone was a crappy LG that sucked as far as anything internet was concerned....but for text/talk it was always solid and reliable pretty much anywhere I've been in the country, and I travel pretty regularly. Very sturdy as well. In fact, the only reason I purchased a new phone is because I had dropped the LG so many times over the years that the case wouldn't stay on. I literally had to Gorilla Tape it so that the case wouldn't fall off and the battery pop out. After about a month of looking at my raggedy-ass tape-phone...I decided it was about time. The other thing that kept me with the LG for so long is that not long after, I also purchased an IPod 5 to have a dedicated mp3 player and because it had a much better camera and was also very good for internet, as long as you were hooked to WiFi. So for the last several years I've carried both devices and would use the LG for calls/texts only (and for internet if I absolutely had to and had no access to WiFi), and would use the iPod for music, internet (WiFi only) and pictures. But after the LG started to fall apart I started looking at consolidating to one device without breaking the bank. That's where the Desire 816 came in.I read a lot of reviews on Amazon and outside sources....and it seemed that for the price this was the best bang-for-your-buck. I read through all the positives and negatives so that my expectations were realisitic and pulled the trigger. First impressions:The phone is pretty big. It's one of the larger phones out there...pretty comparable in size to the IPhone 6S. It seems like most phones are getting larger now days.
