This phone is pretty big but you get used to it quickly. I was afraid that it wouldn't fit in my pockets but it does even if it sticks out a bit. The lock button on the left side was easy to get used to. It doesn't bother me at all. Overall, I love it. It's the size of an iPhone 6 plus and it's one third of the price. Amazing.

column1: Excellent low cost high quality phone!!!!!!
column2: Arrived way before scheduled date, phone was in perfect unopened box with everything that the standard virgin mobile phone comes with. Currently using the phone myself and its amazing. Camera especially but, tends to be a lil shaking and takes slight time to adjust but otherwise perfect for me and my semi- busy and social life. Comes with latest 4.4.2 android and awesome google now voice capability that once you say the key phrase "OK google" from any screen it will immediately start searching and/ or activate your request. This needs to first be activated in the settings of the google now app but once active will be a lifesaver . Also, just to add this phone has fast start-up and if you are switching from another phone it comes built it with this HTC transfer tool that allows you to transfer everything over to this one but, if transferring from an Android you need to download that app first on your old phone and I think for iPhones you need to transfer your info to a PC then transfer via USB cable.

I've had it for several months and no issues. It took awhile to get used to the size, but now when I use other people's "regular" sized phones I feel like Jack and the bean stalk, they look so small now. Battery life could be better, but I will use this until it dies completely before getting a different phone. Also, using it as a gps on my dash is amazing, the size really helps seeing small roads

column1: I was going to buy a Galaxy until I saw this...
column2: What a fantastic phone/tablet (phablet), especially for the price! The image quality is just fantastic. It is 720p which is lower than high end phones (1080p), but the difference is hardly noticeable. The contrast and colors are near flawless. Sound is amazing, probably the best I've heard on a phone. Camera is 13mp but doesn't take fantastic photos. Photos don't look bad at all, just not great. Kind of a shame due to the fact the rest of the phone is so high quality. If you are looking for a no contract phablet phone in the 200-300 dollar range, this is a no brainer. I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

This is the greatest phone I have ever owned! I am all about taking pictures of my kids and this phone has a 13mp camera!!! Can't get much better than that on a phone!! Plus it has a great screen size -perfect for watching movies on, which leads me to the fact it can hold a 128 GB card!!! You can store a ton of movies and shows on it- which is very handy when ur sitting in a waiting room and your kids are getting antsy!!!

column1: if your thinking about getting it. just get it.
column2: So far love the phone. shipping actually came a day early. ill probably end up doing a full out review on the phone. cuz honestly i was alil hesitant about it, im coming from the sg3 so. but over all bad ass phone takes great picks an videos, enjoy the larger screen. takes alil to get use to holding it but, i dig it, for the price its great. and front facing speakers are actually not to shabby.

column1: Great value! This is a huge phone
column2: Great value! This is a huge phone,thin and has great battery life. I upgraded from my HTC EVO 3D because of its horrible battery life and I'm really satisfied with this one. Camera is better than my last phone although not quit as good as other phones like the galaxy. I do like all the editing features on the camera though. The 4 stars is for the camera .I would defenetly recommend this one.

column1: 3G/LTE works great and even though it is on the same network
column2: I bought this phone to replace my awful Kyocera Rise. Getting used to the larger screen took about a day and now I'm not sure if I could go back to something smaller. I've had this phone for a few months and so far I've had no issues. Battery lasts about a day and a half, 3G/LTE works great and even though it is on the same network, my reception is also better than the Rise. The speech to text is great

column1: Too many ways to say how it's a good phone, but I'll list two
column2: Too many ways to say how it's a good phone, but I'll list two. 1. Camera is remarkable! I've had some very good pictures come from this phone.2. Virgin mobile phones that I've had in past haven't been great with memory, but this one so far is going strong. All in all I've been very pleased with this phone. Having the 5.5" screen I believe is bad because I'll never want something small again.

column1: Runs out of storage and not everything can be stored ...
column2: Runs out of storage and not everything can be stored on an SD card so it is kind of a hassle to juggle around apps when updating them and trying to download new ones. It cannot have very many apps after awhile because the "other" storage keeps growing and leaves no room for anything else... (even with an SD card). But you get what you pay for, so it's alright.

column1: Incredible value, large screen, fast processor
column2: I'm really impressed that Virgin offers such a large phone at such a reasonable price. I'll let others post their technical benchmark results, but I can say that I've had the Note 3 and even if Virgin offered both, I would choose the 816 Desire. Just the general feel of navigating menus and opening applications is quicker on the 816, the screen is nearly as big as far as I'm concerned, the camera is great, and with Virgin's monthly rates, this phone is incredible. To be fair though, the Note 3 excels in most areas, I'm just giving my overall value rating.

I love this phone!The only issue is not enough memory.But that is an issue with many phones. It is loaded with a lot of system files (apps) and I often find myself deleting apps, but overall I am pleased.The call quality is pretty good and the battery life is way better than my old phone.So the phone does everything I need it to do and more.I am very happy with my purchase.

column1: HTC makes beautiful, well built phones
column2: HTC makes beautiful, well built phones...but their Android skin and bloatware make it incredibly frustrating to use. I don't have millions of apps, but the internal storage is so jammed with stuff you can't get rid of, that I have to clear storage/uninstall apps just so I can update other apps, even if they live on my SD card.

column1: three times faster than my galaxy s3, twice as long battery
column2: Love this phone huge 5.5 screen, boom sound, quad core processor, 13 mp camera, NFC, and really sick. I upgraded from Galaxy s3 and love it it lasts more than double that phone for about two days of full usage. And is about 3 times faster, its basically a htc one stripped of a few features with a bigger screen... a must buy.

column1: Very nice HTC for Virgin Mobile!
column2: Very nice mid-range android phone. Quite large. Not really a pocket phone. My last HTC was 4.5 inches and fit well in my front pocket. I use a holster and case for this "beast". It's bigger than I had imagined it to be. I purchased on Amazon without seeing it first. It's not a bad thing that the phone is huge, just keep it in mind if you keep it in your pocket. It's fast, smooth, loud, and has a very nice screen. The battery lasts me all day with basic usage (a couple calls, some texting, some web, and emailing). It does eat battery fairly quick if you do video streaming. The BOOM sound is nice. I really like HTC and Virgin Mobile. They work well together. The battery IS NOT removable. I would have preferred a replaceable battery, but for this price and the quality phone you are getting, its a great value and a nice product. I would definitely buy this again if mine breaks or something happens to it.

column1: I highly recommend this phone. And I wasn't paid to say that..
column2: I've had it for four months now. I love it. I have no battery issues and I'm on this thing all day long. I'm on it as we speak. :-) I use it for everything. Good sounding speaker. For a phone, anyway. Lots of case options to customize.I dropped it seriously twice and it survived fully. I was worried it was too big at first but it really does grow on ya.

Couldn't be more pleased with my purchase of this phone. Went from having an old HTC EVO 3D to this one and I'm happy. Very pleased with the size of the phone (it's big). Speakers on this thing blew me away with how great it sounds. Screen is awesome and camera is awesome as well, great photos! Definitely recommend if you're looking to upgrade from an older phone if you have virgin mobile.

column1: The htc desire 816 is a good phone for the price
column2: The HTC desire 816 is a cheap smartphone trying to give people who want flagship features for a cheap price tag. It mostly succeeds in this. While the phone is smooth for the most part when it comes to navigating through android or applications, I did find a little bit of chopiness or lag when closing applications. The rear facing camera is pretty good, although the zoom isn't the best. The front facing is where it lacks. The photos and selfies taken with the front facing sometimes turn out pixelated, the color is dull and lacking. The overall feel of the phone is ok. The back of the phone is an annoying sticky plastic material that smudges easily and makes the phone feel cheap. It takes a little bit to get used to the left side power button but isn't a problem, and The speakers produce a loud and vibrant sound. Overall it's a nice phone, good for the price and has a couple draw backs.

column1: This is my favorite phone so far, better than my galaxy 3 and cheaper!
column2: I absolutely love this phone. I replaced my samsung 3 with this and it is better! great size screen, good memory ( I would still recommend a sd card), and very slick looking. No known issues with this model. Only downside is it takes a while to charge, but it also takes over 24 hours to die when used a lot with continuous apps running and no battery conservation.

The phone is great, I'm the type of person to do my homework before purchasing any type of device, and this phone has come to be great, but not perfect. As far as specs, everything goes hand in hand. Except for one thing, personally I love taking pictures and as far as the rear camera, with its 13 megapixels, it has yet to fail me. But when it comes to the front camera, although the specs say 5 megapixels, it didn't mention that the front camera seems to be zoomed in. If my arms were 2 feet longer, I'd be happy, but they're not and I'm not too pleased. Even at full arms length, my selfies come out too close. The internal storage isn't my favorite either. Although I try moving everything to my external SD card, it still doesn't give me enough space. HTC uses a lot of space and the RAM isn't enough. But overall, the phone is pretty good. I'd recommend.

At first I had a lot of doubt about buying this phone and the only reason it attracted me was the screen size and of course the price. I have to say after a while of owning and operating this phone daily, this is a great phone. The thing that has surprised me most about this phone is its battery life given that it has a big screen and great sounding speakers.

column1: Gi-nourmous screen! Love this phone. Can't beat it for the price.
column2: Bought this for my daughter and she loves it!The screen is huge!! I'm starting to rethink my Galaxy S5 upgrade and might buy this instead. She plays games on it and it hasn't overheated. The battery hasn't had a problem but it's only been a week. I can't pry this phone from her fingers.She said the internet is pretty zippy and the apps work great.Has a front and back camera.

I am super happy with this phone. So far. I may change my mind as I have it longer. My only "complaint" is that I definitely had to get used to the size. But once I did, I prefer it. I can use it as a mini tablet almost while I'm holding mydaughter --especially when skyping! The camera is fabulous, I can use many different qualities in order to use for messaging or prints. It has a good speed.

This is a really good phone. For a no contract phone, we couldn't ask more for the price. It updated to Android Lollipop right out of the box. It's not going to replace a tablet but a phone should have to. It takes point and shoot quality photos. While it would be too big for me (a guy) to carry in my pocket but is fine for my wife to carry in her purse. Recommended.

I love the HTC desire816!!!! the size of the screen,settings,set up are great! I'm still learning all the features,but the features I do know& use,I love(I love HTC anywayslove,I think they have the best phones out there right now) I have to say at the beginning,I had ordered a different phone but then decided on this one&I'm so glad I did. but as far ascancelling the original order&changinging my order to this phone Amazon was awesome! they we're always right there anytime I called or emailed them,they we're very helpful&made the whole situation a lot easier than I thought. it was the 1st time ever using Amazon&I've used it several times since then.so far I think Amazon is great&will continue using it.now I hope this helps anyone wondering or thinking about using Amazon.......I highly recommend it '''

column1: so you can not purchase a better battery for it
column2: This is the kind of phone that forces you to always carry a charger or power bank everywhere you go. I use the phone mostly for texting and Facebook, and have to charge it twice a day. The phone has an internal battery which can not be removed, so you can not purchase a better battery for it. Other than the battery issue, this phone is a good Virgin Mobile phone.

Bought this in December 2015, so this is a tough one to review because the phone was cheap. Works pretty good but still has many problems! The camera isn't that good but the good news is it works. Sometimes have to restart phone because calls won't come in or go out. But I say if you need a ok phone and this one is on sale for a good price, get it.

Switched from a Galaxy 2 to this HTC. I've only had it a couple of weeks but it has been such a difference. Surprising strong battery for a phone with such a large screen. Transferring all my stuff from my previous phone was a snap with the HTC transfer. Loving my phone, can't recommended it enough. Does not come with a memory card, so switch yours over or buy one ahead of time because it has very little storage on it's own.

column1: Fair price, but you get what you pay for.
column2: I bought this to replace my Galaxy SIII. This was a little cheaper and I figured I'd try something new. Now, all-around it's not a bad phone. However, I wish I'd just gotten another SIII.I'll knock my biggest pet peeve out of the way first. This thing is PACKED with bloatware and none of it can be uninstalled. Over half your memory will be thrown away because of it. This wouldn't be so bad if there was a micro-SD slot, but there isn't. So if storage is an issue for you, do yourself a favor and stop investigating this phone.Next comes the OS. It's clunky sometimes and navigation can be weird. The HOME, WINDOWS, and CLOSE buttons are on the touchscreen, too. Not my preference either. However, I must applaud the auto correct and language recognition software. The suggested words often help me complete entire sentences much faster now.It's fair enough in the hardware department. Screen is clean and the speakers are louder than my SIII's were. The camera is okay, but the autofocus sucks most of the time.Overall, I wish I'd gotten another SIII, but this phone will suffice for now. If you're on a budget it's okay.If you like bloatware.

column1: excellent phone, TERRIBLE customer service with Virgin Mobile
column2: I absolutely love this phone! I just got it last month, and I must say it is perhaps the best smartphone I've ever had! I found it on Amazon for way less than through carrier! My favorite feature is HTC Boomsound. The sound is so crisp and clear. I don't hear any static or crackles. The screen size is excellent! The battery lasts me the entire day! I normally only charge it once a day and then again right before I go to sleep. I don't like the HTC Blinkfeed feature. I feel that it's just software preloaded that bloats my phone. However, I have no problems with lag. The phone is fast, stylish, large, and the sound quality is the best! I previously had the Desire 510 and that was a great phone too, but this one blows it clear out of the water! Thanks, HTC for making an amazing phone & thank you AMAZON for making it affordable!!! (:Update 6/3/16:I had this phone stolen while I was at a park with my family. I contacted Virgin Mobile and the police in my local area and filed a report of stolen property. Virgin Mobile was absolutely no help. They didn't try to track my phone and I insisted that they mark the phone as stolen in their system so that if anyone else tried to activate it, they wouldn't be able to. Well, they gave me the runaround and tried to get money out of me by making me pay for it when I wasn't even using it....Anyway, the phone is absolutely wonderful and I don't regret my purchase one bit, however, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND you buy it through someone other than Virgin Mobile. They are a great company service-wise but their customer service is among the WORST I've ever encountered.

column1: Is this phone right for you?
column2: I like the phone. I was initially concerned about it's size, since I was used to a smaller phone. It took about a week for the phone to "shrink down" and not feel awkward anymore, in other words, I got used to it and now it feels weird when I pick up my old phone. The added real estate makes a world of difference to an old foggy like me, who wakes up every morning with a little less eyesight and a little less hair.As others have mentioned, the sound quality is amazing for such a small device. Now, it's not a heart stopping "boom box" by any stretch of the imagination, but it sounds great for what it is.It has a brilliant display from every angle. I have not seen a phone any clearer or sharper at any price.The cameras are pretty good. I've always had cameras on my cell phones, but I hardly ever used them because I'm a hobby photographer and I don't shoot with anything less than a DSLR. However, I can see myself taking pictures with this one from time to time. Coming from me, that's a compliment. There are better cameras on other phones, but there is nothing wrong with the pictures or video this one can take.HTC has an app that is installed on this phone. It's some live tile application that keeps feeding you whatever you customize it to do. As aforementioned, I'm not a 12 year old girl, so I have no interest in any "social" media apps. I don't care who is doing what, or who said what when. Therefore, I found this app to be annoying and it took me a while to figure out how to get rid of it. If you live and breathe "social" media, you will love this.This phone is for Virgin mobile only. It's a great service for a great price, however, they use the Sprint network, which doesn't have that great a coverage.I don't know what a more expensive phone can do, compared to this one, but I'm certain that whatever it is, I don't need it and it's not worth an extra $400 to me. This is a quality phone with a thin and sleek design. Don't tell HTC, but I think this phone is worth far more than what I paid for it.I didn't give it 5 stars because of the HTC in your face app and because it only comes with 8 gigs of storage, 4 of which is already used up by the OS and by the bloat ware that comes installed on it. I got a 32 gig micro SD to remedy this problem and I highly recommend getting one if you plan on purchasing this phone.

I changed from android to iPhone to android. I didn't know what to think of this phone. I love the size, the speakers,the look. Was am still not a fan of the memory of 8gb, even though it's enough for me, I wish it was a 16gb. Saying that, I couldn't find it this morning, my 1st thought was, where is my beauty. Unlike with my iPhone 5s and other cheapy phones, where I would say, where's my piece of sh#t phone. Lol.

I've had this phone for two years.I love the large screen.It takes the place of a tablet.However, the memory is lacking.My apps can't update because there is not enough memory.I am constantly removing apps, just to update others. This is with a SD card inside too!

Nice nice great fine add a protector case and its not going to slip off your hand very nice display my wife loves it I bought it for her..I can't stand the i phone hype this done performs nicely with out paying hundreds more for a name and its fast enough your not waiting for loading nice operating system very stable and good battery life htc did a great job

column1: This is a great smartphone for the price
column2: This is a great smartphone for the price. It has the qualities of a nice smartphone without being too busy and overdone and it's a good price range. It's nice and.fast, compatible with great apps I use, very durable and a nice feel to it. I recommend anyone who is looking for a decent smartphone for a cheap price to simply invest a couple hundred bucks into this phone...It's amazing

column1: Fast an powerful phone at a low price.
column2: I needed a newer phone for Bluetooth 4.0 and this was priced right. My previous phone was an EVO 3d, so this was a step up in size as well as specs. The increased size makes this a little bulkier, but it makes up for that shortcoming with it's increased speed and larger screen. My one complaint is I seem to have gotten one that won't update. I've tried almost a dozen times so far.

I'm enjoying this purchase with a smile!! No matter what other's have said about this phone. I find it to have all the updated technology I need and the screen is far bigger & better than some of those phones on the market that cost an arm and leg. Don't count the HTC DESIRE 816....out! This reasonable cell phone has what it takes for your everyday usage and more!

I've had this phone for over a month now. I like it, aside from the fact that Virgin Mobile has so many preinstalled apps that there is no space for anything else on this phone. It has an 8gb storage, but almost 5 is already used up. I even bought a 32gb sd card, transferred all my apps over and it still didn't help. If the space issue was fixed I would be giving a good review but I am very dissapointed because its pretty much useless. Plus I asked to return the item and the seller never got back to me.

I absolutely love this phone, I upgraded from the S3 and so far this phone does everything that I need it to do. Don't get me wrong I love my Samsung, but it was old and the screen was shattered and if I could have afforded it I would have got the new Samsung I wanted, but this phone was much more affordable, and I am NOT disappointed with my decision to buy this phone!

column1: ... about 900 times in the last year and the worst I've ever done to it is crack the glass ...
column2: I can't say anything about this phone that isn't already covered by the other reviews except I've dropped it about 900 times in the last year and the worst I've ever done to it is crack the glass in the corner, slightly. Doesn't even go over the screen. Surprisingly rugged for such a big and thin phone. Also the battery life is abysmal, but i learned to work around it.Honestly though, I regret upgrading to lollipop and I'm hoping when I buy a new Desire 816 that I can avoid it. Worse battery life and worse performance.

column1: Awesome phone for a great price.
column2: I bought this phone when it came out last year in January. It's still my main device I use today. The price is great for the phone with a great camera and loud speakers. Would recommend this phone. The only con I have is after a year of moderate usage the device starts to get glitchy , a little faster deteriorationthan better built phones but it's worth every dollar.

column1: Some vendors do not offer any type of warranty so your best bet, even if it's slightly more expensive
column2: Buy your phone from Virgin Mobile's Official site as it does promise a 1 year manufacturers warranty on phones bought directly from them which covers malfunctions from the device. Some vendors do not offer any type of warranty so your best bet, even if it's slightly more expensive, is to go with the smart choice of being able to rely on them if anything goes wrong. Overall a great phone, very fast, Camara takes quick well lit pictures, a phone meant to be used with both hands and quiet bigger than the S5. Switched over from a galaxy and I prefer HTC now due to the customization.

column1: Best kept secret for Virgin Mobile customers!
column2: Went from the iPhone 4 to this phone... It feels great to be back with an android phone! The best thing about this phone besides the screen (which is large and looks fantastic) is the fact that I have yet to feel any lag during use. My iPhone just always seemed to lack much of the hype that all "Apple" people gave it. For the price, this phone is unbeatable. Quit hesitating, don't get the LG Volt, get this phone and you will not be disappointed.

I really like this phone. It's bigger than my usual phones but slimmer. Everything on it runs great, the only negative thing I can point out is the internal storage. You get a measly 8GB which dwindles down pretty fast after all the pre installed apps update. I put in a 16GB SD card and that helped some. Otherwise it is a great phone.

Love this phone. Had it since October and I haven't had any issues. The sound is great when watching movies/you tubeand the pictures come out awesome. I use this for my main phone and I'm able to talk for hours without calls messing up. Only thing is the battery does drain quickly so you may want to keep a charger with you. But great phone over all.

I bought this phone to replace my LG Volt and man is this phone fast and and big, which i like! The battery is pretty good, i play clash of clans and have apps running all day and listening to music at the same time and this battery easily lasts the whole day! The htc desire 816 is the best phone i have purchased from virgin mobile thats for sure. It easily replaced my LG volt which lacked speed, and the camera on this thing is great a 13 mega pixel rear facing camera and a 5 mega pixel front facing camera!

column1: Very nice phone...if only I could get rid of "Smith"
column2: I just got my phone on Friday, Dec 12, 2014. I went through the exact same thing as another customer with Smith disabled. Amazon sent me a new one (really fast). It just arrived today. Opened it up, and right out of the box, I got the Smith notification again. I haven't had any other negative experiences with the first phone. Took it off the charger this morning around 6:30. Carried it to work all day and spent some time on Facebook and Amazon. It still has 68% over 13 hours later. If everything else keeps working fine, I can say it's an overall great upgrade from my old HTC Desire.

Love HTC but don't care for the bloatware, but that has nothing to do with the seller.I would highly recommend this phone if you either buy it unlocked or can get it unlocked.The things that come on an HTC phone kill off battery life quicker than other brands.In saying that, it is an awesome phone.

column1: It's just that the sim is locked to Sprint/Boost Carrier and not At&t
column2: As far as the outlook and performance, it's really good! But the only problem is that after I inserted my AT&T nano sim card, it says " Invalid SIM Card 4G services are unavailable as the SIM/UICC is invalid. Please contact Customer Care."I thought it is locked to Sprint because before inserting the sim card, it said "please insert sprint sim/uicc" so I got an unlock code from HTCUnlockingService.com for which I was not prompted to enter the unlocking code anywhere. It just went into hands free activation. I am having a difficult time with this phone.It'll be great if anyone suggests me what to do or tell me whats the problem.Thank you.

I love this phone. I bought it online without ever seeing one in person and I was surprised how large it is. I have no trouble hearing callers, the volume goes up quite loud, and everybody seems to hear me clearly as well. It also connects flawlessly with the Bluetooth in my car. It charges quickly and stays charged for over a day unless I'm using it constantly as I do when I'm reading a book on it. I have my whole music library on it and the speaker sound is also surprisingly good.

Great phone! Easily moved all my data from my old HTC EVO 3D 4G VM. A little big, but with my aging eyes, easier to see and read. Fast, and plenty of memory for lots of apps! I love it! It was $72 less than Virgin Mobile was selling it for. After purchasing it, Virgin Mobile started offering $60 off, but that still leaves it $12 less than VM. :-)

When it was delivered to my address, i didn't expect for this phone to be huge! I knew it was a 5.5 in screen but it blew my expectations! so far i have no problems with it and enjoy it very much.The only thing i dislike is the back, its very cheap plastic that scratches very easy if its put down flat on a hard surface, i would recommend to buy a case to go with.

The Desire 816 in my opinion is one of the best phones on virgin mobile. First off the screen is a nice roomy 5.5 inch 720p display with great viewing angles and a crisp picture. Second the htc boom sound speakers sound full and rich with a decent amount of bass. Third the rear facing camera is a 13 mp shooter with flash which takes very detailed pictures and the front facing camera is a 5 mp which takes some pretty good selfies. Fourth the snapdragon 400 processor is quick and snappy. The only cons I have for this phone is the funky power button placement and the fingerprint magnet back. But overall this phone is a great mid range phone and is worth checking out a 4 out of 5.P.S. Not a phone for those with little hands.

I have had this phone for 7/8mths now. And it still works like it did when I tookn out the box. Front facing speakers are amazing. Speakers and ver clear, had bass, and are very loud. Back camera takes awesome pics and video's. No lag...doesn't freeze! I do wish it had more memory but that is basically the only negative thing I have to say about the phone.

column1: I love everything about this phone with the exception of the ...
column2: I wanted to wait to rate this phone until I had used it for a while and could give an informed review. I have been using this phone now since August of 2015. I love everything about this phone with the exception of the Internal storage, which is only 8gb. I would rate the phone higher except that after only 6 months I will have to buy another phone or root this one. This is a mid-range phone. I understand that. Maybe I'm just expecting to much. The real problem is that nearly half of the internal storage is already taken up by the pre-loaded bloatware (which you are not allowed to delete) and the OS leaving you just over 4gb for personal use.. until the OS updates and then you have less than 4gb (at least in my experience). The phone has updated several times since then. I keep deleting apps so it can continue to do so. It does allow for an Micro SD but most apps will not load to it. This isn't the fault of the manufacturer but the unnecessary and uninstallable bloatware certainly is. I would gladly pay more for an this phone if I could get it with 16gb instead. I am now at a point where I can no longer update the OS or any of my apps. I'm not gaming on my phone. Most of my apps pertain to a couple of credit cards, some online shopping apps, my online banking, Anti-Virus and my health care apps. Everything that can be moved to the SD card has been moved. If you use very few apps then this phone is wonderful. I wish I could find a replacement for it with a larger internal storage but until then I guess I am going back to Galaxy.02/04/16 UpdateI decided to try rooting the phone before giving up entirely on it. I had to go to the HTC website to get the unlock code to unlock the boot first and it was no easy task. I wouldn't recommend trying to unlock your boot or rooting your phone if you are not pretty comfortable using a computer. I did manage to get back about a gig of storage after I flashed a new and smaller GAPPs package (the google apps package that comes preinstalled on your phone). Once this was done, my phone OS was finally able to update again and now I am back down to almost no internal storage.Virgin Mobile USA has a new phone option available for 2016 which I am going to try. The Samsung Galaxy J3. It comes with 16gb of internal storage. Some specs are not as nice as my HTC Desire 816 and it has a higher price tag of around $180.00 but at least the storage is something I can work with.

column1: Excellent, Very good screen Only minor issue
column2: Excellent,Very good screenOnly minorissue,is vibrate is a little weak (on my last phone, we could use vibrate to locate the phone)Everything else is excellent. Sound qualityexcellent.Very responsive.Easy to activate also, with help from Virgin.Same quality as phones which are twice (or three times the price)

I upgraded my wife's phone from a Samsung Galaxy Mini (that couldn't stay on!!!!) to this little gem. It has enough RAM and Memory space for what she needs, she loves the new camera and is on her new phone a lot LESS, because she can actually do all her "things" and spend more time with me!Fast, Great and Amazing phone!

Terrible terrible terrible! The phone came with the internal storage FULL. It had 8 GB but it came preloaded with a bunch of useless apps that COULD NOT BE UNINSTALLED. I couldn't uninstall any of the apps, soI couldn't download any new apps. I bought a 16 GB SD card and still couldn't download any apps! The way it works is that you have to download apps to the phone and then transfer the apps to your SD card. But, the phone came FULL, so I couldn't download anything to the phone, and thus couldn't transfer any apps to my SD card. I even called tech support. Spent an hour on the phone with them, and they couldn't even help me. Really sucks. Such a nice phone but utterly useless.

With any new phone, it takes time to familiarize yourself with the environment.But, it all came together and I am loving the features.I love the size of this phone too; much bigger than my last phone.My service with Virgin mobile is affordable and I receive service in areas I never used to with my other phone.Happy customer here.

column1: Phone's been working great for over a year
column2: Phone's been working great for over a year. One annoying thing is that many apps won't save on my microSD card, though, so I am always having to make more space in the main storage area for updates, etc.

column1: No ability to use two apps at once! Otherwise a good phine
column2: Thought this phone was a praised a little too much for why I expirienced, but overall a great phone. Camera 4/5 (excessive editing features that yet lacks a few basic ones such as photo brightness) speed 3/5 (only used for 2 weeks) screen 5/5, OS 4/5 ( LACKS ABILITY TO USE TWO APPS AT ONCE! huge letback for a large phone !

column1: Nice phone for those not into the latest gadgets
column2: It was a gift for my husband.He loves it! He's not a big on keeping up with the latest gadgets, so this phone to him was like getting the latest and greatest.So, I am happy I made the right choice for him.The pics come out clear and he has had virgin mobile network for YEARS.He is happy with the service they provide.

column1: I love this phone with it's 5
column2: I love this phone with it's 5.5" screen and excellent WiFi capabilities. The rearcamera is 13 megapixels and is a serious upgrade from my last phone. The music on this device is very good with the dual speakers. I would recommend downloading an equalizer from GooglePlay for anadded boost. only little negative is the battery life. If you are careful and use power saver when you can you should not have an issue. Got this for an amazingly low 179.00 and I am very pleased.

column1: likely the best virgin mobile phone
column2: *in a way,likely the best virgin mobile phone.no,feature wise it's not quite my galaxy s3(by any stretch)-but it does have size over the s3,which is a definite plus.battery far excels the galaxy&the settings inclusive dual battery/&extreme battery save options certainly come in handy during travel time without charger.price:@$180on Amazon last time I checked,need I say more?again,perhaps the best virgin phone(ie,bang4buck wise)hence,5star rating*

Love the phone so far! Nice sized screen, vibrant colors, sound is awesome, front facing and rear camera is lovely even with dim light ! Only 2 things that I don't like 1. I can't press the spacebar without accidentally hitting the home button instead 2. The power and volume buttons are too close together and sometimes I'd hit the wrong button (try to turn the volume up and accidentally lock my phone!). Otherwise I love it....and it comes with all the emojis I can think of ! No more downloading an emoji keyboard app. 👍

column1: Great phone...recommend buying HTC over Samsung
column2: Really glad I found this phone.I had 3 different Samsungs over the years (including the Galaxy III) and they all fell apart within 9 to 12 months.This phone has been super durable with great battery life.I am a fan of HTC's and will continue buying them.Nothing better than finding a product at a good price that lasts long.

column1: Already dropped with no case and no marks, cracks or scratches!
column2: I got this as a present for my daughter for Christmas.She was so excited when she opened it up!The phone has worked so well and we have had know problems with it whatsoever, she has even dropped the phone a few times and I am happy to report that it has not cracked due to the special screen HTC uses.Great product!

So far so good.It's my first day using it so time will tell.Day one included an easy set up on-line at Virgin Mobile site.Contacts migrated simply just by logging into Google (although Google was missing a few for some unknown reason, so I did the blue tooth sync with my prior phone to get the rest and then it had a selection to automatically delete any duplicates).Display is clear, audio speakers strong, and phone use audio clarity (tested both receiving and speaking from the Desire 816) is excellent.Display is sharp with select-response time better than I've experienced with my two prior Androids.My prior phone was the LG Optimus F3 4G LTE with a 4 inch display; and this 5.5 is noticeably more like a tablet, but it's still easy to hold and use as a phone.I don't regret that larger size which makes for great internet surfing.And it fits well in my pocket -- not as much of a difference in handling as I had anticipated.

This is a big phone bit not too big to handle. So far I really like it. The LTE download is 56mbs verses my home cable wifi at 13.5mbs. The screen is crisp and the front BOOM speakers are the best of any phone Ive ever had. The shinny plastic back makes the phone slippery tho, easy fix with some 440 sandpaper

One of the best phones I ever owned! Took amazing pictures, was fast, easy to use, large screen size was perfect! My only complaint was the amount of storage. If it hadn't gotten damaged I would still be using it. I had it a little over two years with no issues.

I love everything about this big phone, most of all, the camera. The only reason I didn't give this five stars is because I neglected to check the storage capacity. Opt for one with more storage space, because even with the microSD, this phone lacks sufficient storage; and I am not a big app kind of guy. Still a great phone.

column1: Best HTC phone I've had in a while, but still some issues.
column2: Nice big screen, pretty fast, fairly good battery life. Only issue is it is so thin it is hard to hold on to. I would prefer a little more thickness as a bigger battery. Also having all the buttons in a row means accidentally turning the screen off when I mean to turn the volume up. Sense lacking a message widget stinks too.

I love this phone. The only things I have a problem with, having come from the ease of a Samsung is the notification tone sounds when you're on the phone so you get a super loud tone in your ear.And it's almost impossible...or I haven't found out how...to post a photo from your gallery to Facebook.I love the size.

column1: A good phone.  I like it. Would recommend to others.
column2: This was a replacement for my old HTC phone. It was cheaper than the last one by almost $100. Transferring stuff from one phone to the other was very easy with the transfer tool and the HTC back up account I had. The phone is big but not uncomfortable to carry around or use. I don't use the camera very much but it seems good.

I got this phone back in October to replace my Samsung 3.I am a nurse and a graduate student so I have many functional apps I need on a daily basis.This phone has 8 GB ROM but by the time you consider the HTC bloatware that comes on it, there's only about 4GB free for my own use.I am upgrading to the Galaxy S5 and giving this to my husband who is not as dependent on his phone and uses very few apps/functions.It is a great phone and I loved it, but even the SD card wasn't enough to save it for me.

column1: It runs nice. I'd recommend it
column2: HTC has a glitch where you put in an aixillary cord. It constantly brings up Google talk. I can't listen to Pandora. This phone also won't let you delete frequently contacted people in texting. It runs nice. I'd recommend it. However I cry a little every time I get in the car and can't plug my phone in to listen to Pandora.

Phone just completely stopped working. Could not system recovery it or get it past the HTC screen. Because the phone was turned on prior to my purchase was not able to get a new phone from VM. Will be doing what it takes to get refunded. This is asinine.

column1: Good enough for those who are smart enough to keep ...
column2: Good enough for those who are smart enough to keep up with technology, but not too much for those who aren't in the loop. Fast response, good volume and call quality. Have to restart maybe once a week but no problem even with that. Have bought replacement due to being run over (!!!!!), but that wasn't the fault of the phone. :)

column1: One of the best phones for the price that works on Virgin mobile
column2: One of the best phones for the price that works on Virgin mobile.I've had this phone for over a year, and my biggest issue is the internal storage.A lot of Apps that cannot be removed only leave you with about 4GB of internal storage which sucks.If they offered another version with more internal storage I would buy that.You can buy an external storage card, but that doesn't help with a lot of Apps that cannot be moved off of the internal storage.

column1: This one is for the win
column2: I bought this to replace a casio gz commando and a nokia lumia 510. It was worth it completely. This phone is fun and fast and cool in every way possible for android usages. Good for video viewing and photography and gaming. Good software and apps but phone storage is crap mine is almost full 8gb not enough room.

column1: Great Buy for Virgin Mobile Customers
column2: Affordable, variety of beneficial features, sound design among the best simply because the screen up placement of the phone allows the speaker sound full range, and a battery "cycle" that promotes long term use.Con: Very flashy in not so safe areas...

For the money, you're not going to find a better phone. For more money, you might, but then, if you had a lot of money to blow, you'd already have bought your Samsung Galaxy or iPhone. Call quality is probably more "okay" than "great," but the screen size is outstanding, and resolution is surprisingly clear. Again, there are better phablets out there, but they will cost you more money; you aren't going to find a better under-$200 phablet.

720p is good enough, boomsound is loud, battery is good, camera is fantastic, its got enough ram and cpu power. this is hands down the best 'no-contract' phone for sale on amazon. you can always go the unlocked phone route if you're going prepaid, but you're not going to find anything comparable to this for the price.

If you put your phone in your back pocket, it will eventually pop out and not want to stay in that side slot it's in for some reason. had 2 of these both did not last long before break down went to a samsung j7 with still works6 years latter now I have a moto g power witch I love

This is my third HTC Android phone and I love it.Plenty of internal memory for lots of apps, phone is fast and responsive, the speakers are far better than most cell phones, and the screen looks great.I have not found any app that has trouble running on this phone, including a couple very big games.I've found battery life to be very good, and I use the screen on a very bright setting.You'll use far less power on Wifi than LTE - but either way it'll get you through the day with normal use.Camera is best HTC I've had so far, but still leaves a lot to be desired (get it?), especially in lower light or fast action situations.It does actually work fairly well with the flash - a first for a phone that I've owned.The whole "photographer's dream" description is a bit much.

I received my smartphone yesterday in estimated time. Appreciate you Seller! =) I love this smartphone... The camera takes great pictures, the speeds is fast & lag free, HTC U.I. looks awesome & simple; they don't have lots of unnecessary bloatware apps like Samsung have! HTC kept it minimal on apps that everyone will uses daily! I thought 5.5in was gonna be too big, but it's not... I can type with one hand & see more informations on the screen via websites & social networks. This phablet is the right size, even if you have average size hands. If anyone wants to buy the HTC Desire 816 by Virgin Mobile; I recommend this seller! =) I'm happy! =)

I really enjoy the settings on the phone in regarding of conserving the battery life. The battery life within itself is pretty long for me. This phone took awhile to prepare for shipment but I was able to get it in two days after it was shipped. I'm very happy with my purchase and I would purchase this phone again without hesitation if I ever needed to.

Works and sounds great but short on space and even if you add card I can't figure out how to make things go directly to card so I am constantly moving things. Maybe I'm just stupid. I like to use speaker phone which sounds great. I also use it to play music as I walk dogs.

Awesome phone!! Great speakers, huge screen, only setbacks is the fact you can't take battery out if or when it goes bad on u. You would have to purchase new phone. SIM card pops out often and internal memory is 8gb but unless u root it and get rid of all the preinstalled apps u will have no space to download apps. I've got a 16 gb SD card but no apps will transfer to it because as u know any app u download has to go on internal memory before you can transfer it. Otherwise, it's a great phone. I had a LG volt and this phone blows it out of the water.

It was kind of confusing, compared to what I had before.But once I worked with it.I love it.For the cost, you are getting everything you need, and more.Credits to HTC for a good product.Hope I'm not disappointed down the road. To good to be true at this point.

Large screen;

This phone rocks! Hands down 1 of the best smart phones out there. All the bells and whistles of the ridiculously expensive options (not that there is anything wrong with that) without the price tag. I would've preferred a different carrier but I haven't been disappointed with Virgin so far. Love, love this phone. If you are considering getting this, trust me, you won't regret it. Get it already!

column1: I'll most def give it a two thumbs up 👍👍
column2: I've had this phone for over two months now and I still love it. I was in search for a new phone and I spotted this phone in RadioShack but it was wayyy out of my budget. My ma had a smart idea to see if it would be cheaper on Amazon and it was so I purchased it right away. The shipping was pretty fast. It came like two days after I ordered it. If you're a female with big hands like myself and want a nice sized phone to make your hands feel smaller, lol, this is the right purchase. Or if you just want a bigger phone to have with cheap monthly payments this is definitely a two thumbs up. If you do buy it, I hope you enjoy it as much as I've been enjoying mine.

column1: Love the phone but Kit Kat operating system will not ...
column2: Love the phone but Kit Kat operating system will not allow you to access the external sd card. Phone only has 4GB of internal storage after all the junk apps built in, and they hype it up saying you can add up to 128GB with micro memory card. They just don't tell you, you can't access it!

Wow. First of all let me tell you how amazing this device is. For the price it's incredibly quick, the camera is amazing, and the audio....just wow. Now as for the shipping it was a little confusing at first but was very responsive and fast. I would definitely recommend this device to anyone.

Amazing HTC Desire 816. I love it. I'm happy to buy this product. Come very quickly. I don't have any problems with this. Working very well exactly instructions the box package. The company work good. Thank you Amazon and SellerFor sale excellent products.

column1: The boom sound is great for phone & video
column2: Big improvement after Kyocera Vibe blew speaker .The boom sound is great for phone & video.HTC guide made it easy to transfer content phone to phone quickly,besides setting up & answers for all functions,screen color awesome so far I'm very happy with purchase

column1: GLAD TO HAVE THE SAME ONE
column2: I bought this phone over two years ago, and when family and friend's expensive phone would not pick up mine did. When my phone was broken I was approved to get one of the expensive phone's, but what I wanted was a phone like my old phone. When I saw Amazon actually had one new HTC 816, I quickly bought it. My old one lasted over two years with NO problems, so when the new one comes I will be set for another two or more years.

I've had my HTC Desire 816 for a little over a year now and I can honestly say this is the best phone I've ever had. I purchased the phone on a little bit of a whim after my S3 started getting glitchy and the charging port stopped working. I initially wanted to stay with the Samsung Galaxy line but the S5 was too much for me at $500. Now I have no urge to buy a Galaxy product again.The 816 is a large phone, bigger than a Note 2, but I find it very comfortable to hold. It has a dual sim option as well as an expandable SD slot. It rings loudly and it's easy to hear someone you're having a conversation with. I never have a problem with getting a clear signal, even while traveling in big cities or the middle of nowhere. The back camera takes excellent photos. I can multitask with no problems. The battery life is better than my S3. With heavy use the phone lasts about 6 hours, medium use 12+ hours, minimal use at least a day and a half. I enjoy the different ways I can customize the phone with minimal effort using pre-made themes or by creating my own, hiding or arranging apps in the menu as I see fit, making custom ringtones from music on my SD card and more. The speakers are on the front of the phone instead of the back, so when listening to music without headphones I can leave my phone face up without the sound being muffled.The cons for the phone are that the front facing camera often force closes, the headphone jack is easily bumped and disconnected, and it comes with quite a bit of bloatware from Virgin Mobile, Google, and HTC. I've disabled or uninstalled most of it, but intend on rooting the phone to further clear it out. Other nitpicky things are that the notifications bar is very cluttered, the LED notification light is only red and green with no options for other colors, and Dot View is not supported by the phone but you cannot disable it.All in all I'm very happy with my purchase and I hope Virgin Mobile continues to add HTC phones to their lineup.

I am seriously obsessed with my new phone!!!!!! the only thing my mom and i both have an issue with is memory. she bought a 68gb card and still is having issues with low memory. 7 of the 8gigs are used right away. :( if anyone knows why this is happening please let me know.

When I broke my HTC desire 5(?)16 on vacation I found that upgrading to the 816 was the same price so decided to go for it.The phone is enormous and though I was worried at first, now I can't imagine going back.Very fast also, gorgeous display, highly recommended.

column1: Awesome phone! Much more affordable alternative to some of ...
column2: Awesome phone! Much more affordable alternative to some of the major flagship phones out there. The processor is very fast compared to my S2, the 5.5" is great, and the battery is the best I've ever used. Was hesitant at first to buy this phone, but now I don't regret it at all.

I could rave about this thing. It's huge, yes, and it'll take a bit of getting used to... But now everyone else's phone feels like a tiny cheap toy in comparison.Awesome picture and phenomenal sound, great for Netflix! Decent battery unless you're on it every minute of the day.

column1: The phone is very beautiful had extremely good battery life
column2: The phone is very beautiful had extremely good battery life, and a nice camera. The only problem was my storage it wouldn't let me delete certain things I later got it fix. Now the phone works fine I have no complaints about this phone.

I've gone through so many Android phones at VM and this one is the best one yet. The camera has lots of features and the screen is HUGE. I recommend buying a micro sd card. Battery life lasts about 8 hours with continuous use (IG, Twitter, Games, Emails) but on standby the battery could last a full day.

column1: the only major deal breaker that I have with this phone is that mine came with a bad headphone jack input
column2: Switched from a iPhone 4 and dont miss it at all,the only major deal breaker that I have with this phone is that mine came with a bad headphone jack input,everytime I connect my headphones,they just would stop working due to poor connectivity and I tried different types of headphones,so at this point I don't want to bother returning the phone, so I'm using my old iPhone still for my workouts, is sad couse if it wasn't for this essential manufacturing issue I'd give this phone 5+

Sound amazing. Video and music playback nice. Installed 64gb sdram chip. Speed fast. Camera so-so. Installed with kitkat. Don't bother upgrading to lollipop, eats up internal storage with little new benefit. Supposedly android 6.0 coming soon.

Very good choice for a phone, even with 2015 standards! This is a great phone for the new android user, or even someone looking for a small upgrade. The only downside is the 8GB of storage runs out extremely quick, so make sure you get an SD Card to expand that! It performs quite well for only having 1.5GB of ram!

column1: ... to this phone a few weeks ago and I love it. It took 2-3 days to get used ...
column2: Upgraded to this phone a few weeks ago and I love it.It took 2-3 days to get used to the larger size but now everything else seems too small.The phone works great and is so much faster than my old phone.There is plenty of room to install apps.The screen is clear and everything looks great-pics,videos,apps.The battery life is decent.If I just text and Web browse it lasts all day.If I play games a bit more then it needs a charge in the evening.I would recommend it if you are looking for a bigger phone without breaking the bank.

I really liked this phone at first. If you would have asked me the first week I would have given it 4 stars. But the amount of HTC bloat ware really limits this phone. After updates there is not any room left. And the operating system limits what can be moved or stored to an ad card. That and bad battery life make very unusable.

i love this phone,its a great mid-level phone,its fast ,has a nice big screen...and very nice,speakers are really good for cell phone speakers,i wish the battery life on it was a little better but still decent,i got it for 179.99 and at that price thats a STEAL,i highly recommend this phone

Not much to say about this one. IT’S A GREAT PHONE!!; no complaints so far considering the price. It’s the best phone option out there for Virgin Mobile. This phone easily can compete with the $500s price range phones from the less affordable carriers. Thanks Virgin Mobile & HTC.
This is a very good cell phone. Although, it is an android cell phone, it does the job well enough fit its purpose. A competitive cell phone when compared to other androids.

column1: It is well made and dependable and has great features. The best phone I've ever owned
column2: I cannot express how impressed I am with this phone. I've been using it for some months now and it has never, once, locked up on me or needed any kind of tech support/troubleshooting. It is well made and dependable and has great features. The best phone I've ever owned.

Phone arrived in good condition. Just had to get use to the power button being on the side. Not that big of a deal.. The glossy back doesn't bother me either because i always buy a phone case anyways. This is a really nice mid-range phone. I recommend getting the latest Lollipop O.S update too. Just make sure you do it over WIFI while it's completely charge. The phone ran a lot smoother afterwards. It's only been a couple of days but i'm happy. If you're with Virgin Mobile, this is a steal for sure.

column1: it is the worst piece of crap out there
column2: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE! it is the worst piece of crap out there!!!first off, i ordered one that said 8gb of memory and on my phone it even said 8gb. For some reason i got screwed over. on my computer when i connect it, it says i only have 4gb, which explains why i can only have like four freaking apps!Next, I don;t know if its cause the memory is always full or whatever, but my apps are ALWAYS crashing! i have at least two apps crash A DAY!!!, Alsoit is always lagging and glitching!!! For example, i will be on facebook then it will freeze, ill try and fix by pressing the home button and it will freak out. This is probably the worst smartphone i have ever experienced in my LIFE!!!! I would not wish this phone on my worst enemies!!! Stay away from this $#@^ing phone if you can!!! do not get misled!!!!! IT IS NOT A GOOD PHONE!!!!You are better off saving for a galaxy or iphone!

Love this phone for the basics; calls and texting, but also for the excellent large screen. It has for many tasks replaced my laptop. It works great for GPS, watching Netflix and Amazon prime, and listening to music. Only limitation for me is the 8 gig memory.

Wayy bigger than expected, in the best way possible! Has about 8 GB of phone storage, with capabilities of an SD card of up to 32 GB and you CAN move apps to SD card if the app allows it. Built in "Swype" and emoji keyboard, amazing camera! Kids mode account option, updates to Android Lollipop, you can download more fonts on Google play, built in flashlight , and amazing speakers. All in all this is a huge bargain for the quality! 💗 Hope this helps!

Very happy with this phone.Very happy with battery life.Previously had an HTC evo and the battery life was terrible from the beginning and only got worse so this is quite nice to have a phone that can go 36 hours on a charge.Its bigger than my friends Samsung galaxy S5.The size took a little while to get used to, but now I love it!

column1: Screen as big as an iPhone 6 Plus at 1/4 ...
column2: Screen as big as an iPhone 6 Plus at 1/4 the cost.This is a solid performer.13 MP front camera is actually FIVE MP more than the 6 Plus.Rear is 5 MP which is 3.8MP more than the iPhone.More apps on Google Play, too.

It's a good phone. It's fast, I've never had an issue with it freezing, which is scary considering the battery is inaccessible. The screen is huge and is of good resolution, but has a lower pixel density that higher end phones. The rear camera is of good quality and front facing camera is higher in resolution than other comparable phones. The flimsy casing is something of concern. I've had mine over two weeks and the back of the phone has cracked starting at the headphone jack. The back is also a fingerprint magnet. For a mid range phone, it packs a lot of favorable specs at a good price.Pros:+ Large screen+ Fast processor+ Price+ Slim+ Light+ Camera QualityCons:- Fixed Battery- Plastic body/Flimsy feel- Glossy plastic back attracts fingerprints

Really love this phone. The battery lasts a really long time and it is easy to set up and use. It does need to be turned off/restarted every now and again to stop it from getting glitchy but other than that I have no complaints. I have had this phone for months now and I will never go back to Samsung!

column1: Great phone. It's big but thin so it really ...
column2: Great phone.It's big but thin so it really doesn't feel much more bulky than my old Samsung Galaxy S3.It's speedy and works well.I was a little concerned about not having a removable battery but battery life is great.We'll see how than pans out over the long run though.I just wish there were more accessories out there for it.Cases and such.

This phone is almost perfect. The sound is great, the camera is great, the screen is big and has awesome resolution, and on the two months I've had it, it hasn't had many hiccups. But, the big issue is memory. It does allow you to put in a memory card, which helps a little, but you can't put very much on it. The phone itself comes with so much bloatware that it's hard to actually download what you want. Aside from that, this phone is great.

column1: The phone so far is great. Still getting everything set up on it
column2: The seller promised the phone would be delivered by 8pm on Friday 6/5,I rec'd it much earlier in the day.The phone so far is great.Still getting everything set up on it.I bought this phone based on a recommendation from my sister and after reading all the great reviews on Amazon.

column1: Love it! It's a replacement for an iphone 5
column2: Love it! It's a replacement for an iphone 5. Yes, it's an upgrade! I guess it's the best product at this price! Well made, big and clear screen, good sound. The only con is the camera, which is not so good as most people said, maybe because i compared it with my SLR.

column1: Worst phone I've ever owned, lasted less than two months before breaking.
column2: This was such an upsetting phone! Honestly, the worst one I've ever had, and it lasted me less than two months and now it's failing to respond to touch: the screen is NOT cracked because I'm careful with my phones, but it's got this almost cracked appearance underneath the touch screen and whenever I try to answer a phone call or do anything, it is completely unreadable. Merely colorful lines all violently moving across the screen. I've had problems with this phone before: Updates that would cause endless crashes to the point that I couldn't do anything with the phone except a factory reset., horrible lag to the point I'd have to restart it regularly, and the unnecessary HTC backup that I couldn't find a way to turn off. I'm done with this product and its producer.

column1: Best Phone I Have Ever Had
column2: What an amazing phone!I can use this phone extensively for 4 full days before needing a charge.This includes calls, texting, web browsing, downloading from Google Play and everything else.You better jump on this deal before Amazon realizes it is under priced.

column1: if your'e deciding between this and the volt - go with this!
column2: This phone is amazing. I haven't set it up yet since I've only had it for about an hour. But I love it. It's replacing my sprint galaxy s3.I never disliked my galaxy but I've gotten use to my galaxy tab s 8.4 - so the bigger screen size on this phone isn't too much of an adjustment.This feels like a great phone it actually fits in my hand better. Although I don't have a case on it yet and my galaxy had an otterbox. Which is going to be really nice for resale value since it protected it perfectly over the past two years - but it jumped out of my hands about 50 times so the otterbox was more cumbersome it seemed. And at this price point, with a standard gel case - if I do break the phone it won't break the bank to replace.The best part about this phone though - bought it on Sunday afternoon and here, Tuesday afternoon it is with free shipping. Guess there's an amazon warehouse on the other side of my state now.*UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE* - VIRGIN MOBILE SERVICE IS AMAZING.My work is notorious for having zero cell service inside. AT&T was the only carrier that anyone ever received service inside where they could make regular calls. That is until I purchased this phone and set it up through virgin mobile. I had sprint before and I could not make a call 99% of the time until I was down the street from my work. Well I just made a call from inside to another skeptics phone(which went to their voicemail) and they were in shock when I put the call on speaker. They tried to tell me my service was lousy and that I left a perfectly good carrier(sprint)Well I just made a call and sent a text just fine from inside our aluminum cell block. It is official. whether it's virgin mobile or the HTC 816 or the two together. This carrier and phone just hit my all time best buy list. Thanks amazon, virgin mobile, htc... I feel like I just one the little league world series.*UPDATE*So after using this phone for a few weeks it's still amazing. Such a great deal. It is in fact, the perfect size for a phone ever.It never flies out of my hand like my GS3 did(although I had a clunker otterbox on it which is just awkward to hold) And let me tell you this, the SLOW MO video makes it sooooooo much better. You need a decent amount of light(this goes for almost any device doing this task) but it's slow mo looks incredible. I tried explaining it's awesomeness to my brother(who claimed his phone has that) and had to interupt him and say- "No. This is not the samsung galaxy class video slowed down. This is AWESOME looking slow mo." AND IT RECORDS 60FPS regular for sports or anything you need a higher frame rate for.I'm happy all the reviewers agree that this phone is just a fantastic buy.

I've had it now for a couple weeks.Bought two, one for me and one for the Mrs.Great display, fun to play with.The big display eats into the battery life. So so camera.All in all we are very happy with the phone and very happy -I think- with virgin mobile.Works better with a stylus.A great deal on a very good smartphone.--2 weeks later I've upped by stars to 5I recommend this phone.Great display, everything works.Good not great camera and battery life.GREAT PHONE for the price

column1: still works fine. Any and all phones operating systems will begin ...
column2: Have had this phone for about 2-3yrs now, still works fine. Any and all phones operating systems will begin to degrade after a long time, as well has the actual hardware. But for the age it is doing very well!

I received my phone the next day after I purchased it,it came in virgin mobile packaging with the phone and a charger. The phone itself is awesome, the size is perfect,battery life amazing I charged it for 30 minutes to 100% before I left the house at 9am and its 3:30pm and its only on 75%...the sound is awesome,picture quality is Kool...my only dislike is I had to download a emoji keyboard but other than that everything is great....so far...definitely recommended to android large phone lovers lol

The Desire 816 is larger, about the size of a 3x5 card, but for me, that's a good thing- eyesight issues and large or fumbly fingers are absolutely no problem.The battery has never even come close to running out, barely even losing an eighth of it's charge when I take it out for the day.
